Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY) Holdings Lifted by Deutsche Bank AG
Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY) Holdings Lifted by Deutsche Bank AG
American Banking and Market News
April 12, 2019 Friday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 779 words
Body
Ryanair logo Deutsche Bank AG grew its position in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 90.7% in the 4th 
quarter, according to the company in its most recent filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The fund 
owned 271,500 shares of the transportation company's stock after purchasing an additional 129,128 shares during 
the period. Deutsche Bank AG owned approximately 0.12% of Ryanair worth $19,367,000 as of its most recent 
SEC filing.  
Other hedge funds and other institutional investors have also recently bought and sold shares of the company. 
Harris Associates L P boosted its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 38.6% in the fourth quarter. Harris Associates L 
P now owns 14,358,251 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $1,024,318,000 after acquiring an 
additional 4,002,188 shares in the last quarter.  Baillie Gifford & Co. boosted its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 
15.7% in the fourth quarter. Baillie Gifford & Co. now owns 6,792,319 shares of the transportation company's stock 
valued at $484,564,000 after acquiring an additional 920,644 shares in the last quarter.  WCM Investment 
Management LLC boosted its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 2.8% in the fourth quarter. WCM Investment 
Management LLC now owns 4,277,128 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $305,130,000 after 
acquiring an additional 115,663 shares in the last quarter.  Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA boosted its 
holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 27.5% in the fourth quarter. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA now owns 
3,458,575 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $246,734,000 after acquiring an additional 
745,493 shares in the last quarter.  Finally, JPMorgan Chase & Co. boosted its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 
17.3% in the third quarter. JPMorgan Chase & Co. now owns 1,983,410 shares of the transportation company's 
stock valued at $190,487,000 after acquiring an additional 293,233 shares in the last quarter. Hedge funds and 
other institutional investors own  43.69% of the company's stock.  
Shares of NASDAQ:RYAAY  opened at $76.45 on Friday. The company has a market cap of $17.11 billion, a P/E 
ratio of 10.84 and a beta of 0.73. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 1-year low of $65.61 and a 1-year high of $123.19. 
The company has a quick ratio of 0.91, a current ratio of 0.91 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.68.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last issued its quarterly earnings results on Monday, February 4th. The transportation 
company reported ($0.10) EPS for the quarter, missing the Thomson Reuters' consensus estimate of $0.25 by 
($0.35). The firm had revenue of $1.80 billion during the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $1.80 
billion. Ryanair had a net margin of 14.65% and a return on equity of 25.18%.  As a group, sell-side analysts 
anticipate that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post 5.94 EPS for the current year.  
Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY) Holdings Lifted by Deutsche Bank AG
RYAAY has been the subject of several recent analyst reports. HSBC cut shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a 
"hold" rating and set a $73.00 price objective for the company. in a report on Tuesday, April 2nd. Cantor Fitzgerald 
upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on Wednesday, February 6th. Zacks 
Investment Research  upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating and set a $76.00 target 
price for the company in a report on Monday, January 21st. Morgan Stanley cut shares of Ryanair from an 
"overweight" rating to an "equal weight" rating in a report on Tuesday, January 22nd. Finally, BidaskClub cut shares 
of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "sell" rating in a report on Wednesday, January 16th. Four equities research 
analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, five have issued  a hold rating and six have given a buy rating to the 
company's stock. Ryanair presently has an average rating of "Hold" and an average price target of $78.00. 
Ryanair Company Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

EU court dismisses Lufthansa action on subsidy for German airport
EU court dismisses Lufthansa action on subsidy for German airport
dpa-AFX International ProFeed
April 12, 2019 Friday 6:07 PM GMT
Copyright 2019 dpa-AFX Wirtschaftsnachrichten GmbH All Rights Reserved
Length: 236 words
Body
       LUXEMBOURG (dpa-AFX) - An EU court on Friday dismissed a legal action by German airline Lufthansa that 
contested subsidies to Frankfurt-Hahn Airport and contracts it entered into with Dublin-based budget carrier 
Ryanair.  Lufthansa, which does not use the airport, had failed to show that its business had been negatively 
affected enough to justify its complaint, the European Union's General Court ruled. 
 At issue are subsidies worth millions of euros paid out in previous years. Lufthansa - Europe's largest airline if all 
its subsidiaries are included - alleged unfair competition.  It challenged a 2014 decision by the European 
Commission to approve the subsidies, on the basis that they were not in breach of EU competition rules.  Hahn lies 
some 120 kilometres from Frankfurt, where Lufthansa has its main hub.  The 2014 decision allowed payments to 
Hahn airport by Fraport, which operated both Hahn and Frankfurt Airport at the time, as well as two German states.   
Of the three, only one of the German states - Hesse - still holds a minority share in Hahn. In 2017, China's HNA 
took over 82.5 per cent of the airport.  The commission decided in 2014 that the support for Hahn airport was either 
not state subsidies or was compliant with EU subsidy rules.  Lufthansa said it would consider whether to challenge 
the decision before the European Court of Justice, the bloc's top tribunal.   Copyright dpa

European ADRs Move Higher in Thursday Trading
European ADRs Move Higher in Thursday Trading
MT Newswires Live Briefs
April 11, 2019 Thursday 10:47 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 231 words
Body
 American depositary receipts of European stocks were trading 0.09% higher at 1,060.86 on the BNY Mellon 
Europe Select ADR Index on Thursday.
In continental Europe, the gainers were led by Deutsche Bank (DB), and financial services firm Credit Suisse (CS), 
which rose 3.4% and 2.3% respectively. They were followed by life insurance firm Aegon (AEG), and financial 
services company ING Groep (ING), which were up 2.3% and 2.0%.
The decliners in continental Europe were led by biopharmaceutical company Ascendis Pharma (ASND), and 
telecommunications operator Telecom Italia (TI), which fell 3.4% and 1.8% respectively. They were followed by 
internet advertising company Criteo (CRTO), and internet browser company Opera (OPRA), which dropped 1.5% 
and 1.3%.
In the UK and Ireland, the gainers were led by biotech company Autolus Therapeutics (AUTL), and specialty 
pharmaceutical company Motif Bio (MTFB), which rose 5.4% and 3.9% respectively. They were followed by airline 
operator Ryanair (RYAAY), and construction materials supplier CRH (CRH) which were up 3.2% and 2.0%.
The decliners in the UK and Ireland were led by pharmaceutical firm Avadel (AVDL), which lost 8.2%, followed by 
mining company BHP Billiton (BBL), pharmaceutical company AstraZeneca (AZN), and telecommunications 
operator Vodafone Group (VOD), each of which were down 1.2%.
Price: 25.48, Change: +1.18, Percent Change: +4.86

April 11, 2019 Thursday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 773 words
Body
Ryanair logo Manning & Napier Group LLC boosted its stake in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 6.2% 
in the first quarter, according to the company in its most recent 13F filing with the Securities and Exchange 
Commission. The firm owned 264,026 shares of the transportation company's stock after purchasing an additional 
15,331 shares during the period. Manning & Napier Group LLC owned approximately 0.11% of Ryanair worth 
$19,785,000 at the end of the most recent quarter.  
A number of other large investors also recently bought and sold shares of the business. Harris Associates L P 
boosted its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 38.6% during the 4th quarter. Harris Associates L P now owns 
14,358,251 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $1,024,318,000 after acquiring an additional 
4,002,188 shares during the last quarter.  Baillie Gifford & Co. boosted its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 15.7% 
during the 4th quarter. Baillie Gifford & Co. now owns 6,792,319 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$484,564,000 after acquiring an additional 920,644 shares during the last quarter.  WCM Investment Management 
LLC boosted its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 2.8% during the 4th quarter. WCM Investment Management LLC 
now owns 4,277,128 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $305,130,000 after acquiring an additional 
115,663 shares during the last quarter.  Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA boosted its stake in shares of  
Ryanair by 27.5% during the 4th quarter. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA now owns 3,458,575 shares of 
the transportation company's stock worth $246,734,000 after acquiring an additional 745,493 shares during the last 
quarter.  Finally, JPMorgan Chase & Co. boosted its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 17.3% during the 3rd quarter. 
JPMorgan Chase & Co. now owns 1,983,410 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $190,487,000 
after acquiring an additional 293,233 shares during the last quarter. 43.69% of the stock is owned by institutional 
investors and hedge funds.  
A number of research analysts recently weighed in on the stock. HSBC upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "reduce" 
rating to a "buy" rating in a research note on Tuesday, January 22nd. Morgan Stanley cut shares of Ryanair from an 
"overweight" rating to an "equal weight" rating in a research note on Tuesday, January 22nd. Berenberg Bank cut 
shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "sell" rating in a research note on Tuesday, January 8th. Cantor 
Fitzgerald upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research note on Wednesday, 
February 6th. Finally, Societe Generale upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a 
research note on Tuesday, February 19th. Four equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, 
five have given a hold rating and six have given a buy rating to the company. The stock presently has an average 
rating of "Hold" and an average price target of $78.00. 
Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY ) Shares Bought by Manning & Napier Group LLC
Ryanair stock  opened at $73.04 on Thursday. Ryanair Holdings plc has a twelve month low of $65.61 and a twelve 
month high of $123.19. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.68, a quick ratio of 0.91 and a current ratio of 
0.91. The stock has a market capitalization of $17.11 billion, a PE ratio of 10.36 and a beta of 0.73.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its earnings results on Monday, February 4th. The transportation company 
reported ($0.10) earnings per share for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus estimates of $0.25 by ($0.35). 
Ryanair had a return on equity of 25.18% and a net margin of 14.65%. The business had revenue of $1.80 billion 
during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $1.80 billion.  On average, equities analysts forecast 
that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post 5.94 earnings per share for the current fiscal year.   
Ryanair Company Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

London
London
Financial Times (London, England)
April 11, 2019 Thursday
Edition 1, National Edition
Copyright 2019 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: COMPANIES AND MARKETS;FEATURES; Pg. 26
Length: 195 words
Body
Reckitt Benckiser was the FTSE 100's sharpest faller as Indivior, the drug company that it spun out in 2014, 
crashed by more than 70 per cent.
Indivior said it had been indicted by the US Department of Justice on charges of boosting sales by illicit marketing 
practices since 2010, with the prosecutor seeking damages in excess of $3bn.
The news was a potentially fatal blow for Indivior and would be paralysing for Reckitt, which may pause plans to 
spin off its home care brands until its liabilities were known, said analysts.
Security group G4S jumped after Canadian peer Garda World confirmed it was weighing up a bid for all or part of 
the security services group.
Stagecoach hit its lowest in a decade after the Department for Transport threw the company off all three bid 
shortlists for UK rail franchises, citing its pension liabilities.
Ryanair slipped after Goodbody took the airline off its "buy" list.
Results next month were unlikely to be upbeat given weakening summer season demand, rising fuel prices and 
extra costs related to the delayed delivery of Boeing 737 Max jets, the broker said.
Defence group Qinetiq faded on an Investec downgrade to "hold". Bryce Elder
London
Load-Date: April 10, 2019
End of Document

Length: 195 words
Body
Reckitt Benckiser was the FTSE 100's sharpest faller as Indivior, the drug company that it spun out in 2014, 
crashed by more than 70 per cent.
Indivior said it had been indicted by the US Department of Justice on charges of boosting sales by illicit marketing 
practices since 2010, with the prosecutor seeking damages in excess of $3bn.
The news was a potentially fatal blow for Indivior and would be paralysing for Reckitt, which may pause plans to

Security group G4S jumped after Canadian peer Garda World confirmed it was weighing up a bid for all or part of 
the security services group.
Stagecoach hit its lowest in a decade after the Department for Transport threw the company off all three bid 
shortlists for UK rail franchises, citing its pension liabilities.
Ryanair slipped after Goodbody took the airline off its "buy" list.
Results next month were unlikely to be upbeat given weakening summer season demand, rising fuel prices and 
extra costs related to the delayed delivery of Boeing 737 Max jets, the broker said.
Defence group Qinetiq faded on an Investec downgrade to "hold". Bryce Elder
London

European ADRs Move Lower in Wednesday Trading
European ADRs Move Lower in Wednesday Trading
MT Newswires Live Briefs
April 10, 2019 Wednesday 10:45 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 232 words
Body
 American depositary receipts of European stocks were trading 0.63% lower at 1,058.90 on the BNY Mellon Europe 
Select ADR Index on Wednesday.
In continental Europe, the gainers were led by internet browser company Opera (OPRA), and software firm SAP 
(SAP), which climbed 3.4% and 1.4% respectively. They were followed by pharmaceutical company Grifols (GRFS), 
and telecommunications company VEON (VEON), which rose 0.9% and 0.7%.
The decliners in continental Europe were led by biotech firm Forward Pharma (FWP), and pharmaceutical company 
Novartis (NVS), which fell 1.9% and 1.7% respectively. They were followed by hotel booking site Trivago (TRVG), 
and pharmaceutical company Oasmia Pharmaceutical (OASM), which were down 0.9% and 0.5%.
In the UK and Ireland, the gainers were led by biopharmaceutical company Amarin (AMRN), and specialty 
pharmaceutical company Avadel (AVDL), which rose 2.7% and 2.5% respectively. They were followed by mining 
company Rio Tinto (RIO), and natural gas distributor National Grid (NGG), which were up 1.2% and 0.7%.
The decliners in the UK and Ireland were led by biotech company Autolus Therapeutics (AUTL), and 
biopharmaceutical firm NuCana (NCNA), which lost 3.7% and 3.1% respectively. They were followed by airline 
operator Ryanair (RYAAY), and airplane lessor Fly Leasing (FLY), which were off 1% and 0.3%.
Price: 7.87, Change: +0.21, Percent Change: +2.74

(RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
April 10, 2019 Wednesday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 723 words
Body
Ryanair logo Bank of New York Mellon Corp trimmed its position in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 12.3% in the fourth quarter, according to its most recent 13F filing with the Securities & 
Exchange Commission. The firm owned 118,754 shares of the transportation company's stock after selling 16,586 
shares during the period. Bank of New York Mellon Corp owned 0.05% of Ryanair worth $8,472,000 at the end of 
the most recent quarter.  
Other institutional investors have also recently bought and sold shares of the company. Quadrant Capital Group 
LLC lifted its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 2,727.3% in the 4th quarter. Quadrant Capital Group LLC now owns 
933 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $65,000 after acquiring an additional 900 shares during the 
period.  We Are One Seven LLC acquired a new stake in shares of  Ryanair in the 4th quarter worth approximately 
$116,000.  Raymond James Trust N.A. lifted its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 9.3% in the 4th quarter. Raymond 
James Trust N.A. now owns 2,858 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $204,000 after acquiring an 
additional 244 shares during the period.  PNC Financial Services Group Inc. lifted its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 
15.8% in the 4th quarter. PNC Financial Services Group Inc. now owns 6,203 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $442,000 after acquiring an additional 845 shares during the period.  Finally, Intact 
Investment Management Inc. lifted its stake in shares of  Ryanair by 4.5% in the 4th quarter. Intact Investment 
Management Inc. now owns 6,900 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $492,000 after acquiring an 
additional 300 shares during the period. 43.69% of the stock is owned by hedge funds and other institutional 
investors.  
NASDAQ RYAAY  opened at $73.70 on Wednesday. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.68, a quick ratio 
of 0.91 and a current ratio of 0.91. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 12 month low of $65.61 and a 12 month high of 
$124.33. The company has a market capitalization of $17.32 billion, a P/E ratio of 10.45 and a beta of 0.73.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last released its earnings results on Monday, February 4th. The transportation 
company reported ($0.10) EPS for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus estimates of $0.25 by ($0.35). Ryanair 
had a return on equity of 25.18% and a net margin of 14.65%. The business had revenue of $1.80 billion during the 
quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $1.80 billion.  On average, research analysts expect that  Ryanair 
Holdings plc will post 5.94 EPS for the current fiscal year.  
RYAAY has been the subject of a number of research analyst reports. HSBC raised shares of Ryanair from a 
"reduce" rating to a "buy" rating in a research note on Tuesday, January 22nd. Morgan Stanley lowered shares of 
Bank of New York Mellon Corp Decreases Stake in Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY )
Ryanair from an "overweight" rating to an "equal weight" rating in a research note on Tuesday, January 22nd. 
Berenberg Bank downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "sell" rating in a report on Tuesday, 
January 8th. Cantor Fitzgerald upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on 
Wednesday, February 6th. Finally, Societe Generale upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" 
rating in a report on Tuesday, February 19th. Four research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, five 
have issued  a hold rating and six have issued  a buy rating to the company's stock. The stock  has a consensus 
rating of "Hold" and a consensus price target of $78.00.  
Ryanair Company Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

American Banking and Market News

Body
Ryanair logo Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) have earned a consensus recommendation of 
"Hold" from the sixteen research firms that are presently  covering the firm,            MarketBeat Ratings  reports. 
Four research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, five have assigned  a hold rating and six have issued  
a buy rating on  the company. The average 12 month price target among analysts that have updated their coverage 
on the stock in the last year is $78.00.  
A number of analysts have weighed in on RYAAY shares. HSBC raised shares of Ryanair from a "reduce" rating to 
a "buy" rating in a report on Tuesday, January 22nd. Zacks Investment Research  raised shares of Ryanair from a 
"hold" rating to a "buy" rating and set a $76.00 price target for the company in a report on Monday, January 21st. 
Societe Generale raised shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research report on Tuesday, 
February 19th. Cantor Fitzgerald raised shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research report 
on Wednesday, February 6th. Finally, Morgan Stanley lowered shares of Ryanair from an "overweight" rating to an 
"equal weight" rating in a research note on Tuesday, January 22nd. 
Several hedge funds have recently modified their holdings of RYAAY. Advisors Asset Management Inc. boosted its 
holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 2.3% in the fourth quarter. Advisors Asset Management Inc. now owns 8,631 
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $616,000 after buying an additional 191 shares during the 
period.  Advisor Group Inc. lifted its position in shares of  Ryanair by 2.5% in the 4th quarter. Advisor Group Inc. 
now owns 8,999 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $642,000 after acquiring an additional 218 
shares in the last quarter.  Raymond James Trust N.A. boosted its stake in  Ryanair by 9.3% in the 4th quarter.

purchasing an additional 244 shares during the period.  Comerica Bank boosted its stake in  Ryanair by 1.5% in the

transportation company's stock worth $492,000 after purchasing an additional 300 shares during the period. 
Institutional investors own  43.69% of the company's stock.  
Shares of NASDAQ RYAAY  opened at $73.70 on Wednesday. Ryanair has a twelve month low of $65.61 and a 
twelve month high of $124.33. The company has a quick ratio of 0.91, a current ratio of 0.91 and a debt-to-equity 
ratio of 0.68. The company has a market capitalization of $17.32 billion, a PE ratio of 10.45 and a beta of 0.73.  
Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY ) Receives Consensus Rating of "Hold" from Brokerages
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its quarterly earnings results on Monday, February 4th. The transportation 
company reported ($0.10) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the Thomson Reuters' consensus 
estimate of $0.25 by ($0.35). Ryanair had a net margin of 14.65% and a return on equity of 25.18%. The firm had 
revenue of $1.80 billion for the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $1.80 billion.  On average, equities 
analysts forecast that  Ryanair will post 5.94 EPS for the current year.  
About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Comparing Ryanair ( RYAAY ) and Great Lakes Aviation ( GLUX )
Comparing Ryanair (RYAAY) and Great Lakes Aviation (GLUX)
DailyPolitical
April 9, 2019 Tuesday 4:06 AM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 555 words
Body
Apr 08, 2019( DailyPolitical: http://www.dailypolitical.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY[1]) 
and Great Lakes Aviation (OTCMKTS:GLUX[2]) are both transportation companies, but which is the better stock? 
We will contrast the two businesses based on the strength of their analyst recommendations, valuation, institutional 
ownership, dividends, earnings, profitability and risk. 
Analyst RatingsThis is a breakdown of recent recommendations for Ryanair and Great Lakes Aviation, as provided 
by MarketBeat.com.  Ryanair presently has a consensus price target of $79.00, suggesting a potential upside of 
7.21%. Given Ryanair's higher probable upside, equities research analysts clearly believe Ryanair is more 
favorable than Great Lakes Aviation. Valuation ...rnings This table compares Ryanair and Great Lakes Aviation's 
gross revenue, earnings per share (EPS) and valuation. Ryanair has higher revenue and earnings than Great 
Lakes Aviation. ProfitabilityThis table compares Ryanair and Great Lakes Aviation's net margins, return on equity 
and return on assets. Volatility and Risk Ryanair has a beta of 0.73, meaning that its share price is 27% less volatile 
than the S...00. Comparatively, Great Lakes Aviation has a beta of 5.38, meaning that its share price is 438% more 
volatile than the S...00. Institutional ...sider Ownership43.7% of Ryanair shares are held by institutional investors. 
63.0% of Great Lakes Aviation shares are held by company insiders. Strong institutional ownership is an indication 
that endowments, hedge funds and large money managers believe a company is poised for long-term 
growth.SummaryRyanair beats Great Lakes Aviation on 7 of the 9 factors compared between the two stocks.About 
RyanairRyanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in 
Ireland, the United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of 
various ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of 
beverages, food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel 
insurance through its Website. In addition, it sells bus and rail tickets onboard its aircraft and through its Website, as 
well as gift vouchers through its Website; and markets car parking, attractions, and activities through its Website. As 
of June 30, 2018, the company operated a fleet of 440 Boeing 737 aircraft; and offered approximately 2,000 
scheduled short-haul flights per day serving approximately 200 airports in Europe. Ryanair Holdings plc was 
founded in 1985 and is headquartered in Swords, Ireland.About Great Lakes AviationGreat Lakes Aviation, Ltd., a 
regional airline company, operates as an independent carrier and code share partner with United Air Lines, Inc. in 
the United States. The company offers scheduled air service to its hubs under the Great Lakes brand; and carries 
cargo on its scheduled flights. As of March 20, 2015, it served 28 airports in 9 states with a fleet of 6 Embraer EMB-
120 Brasilias and 28 Beechcraft 1900D regional airliners. The company was founded in 1979 and is headquartered 
in Cheyenne, Wyoming. [ 1]: https://www.marketbeat.com/stocks/NASDAQ/RYAAY/ [ 2]:            
https://www.marketbeat.com/stocks/OTCMKTS/GLUX/

holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 97.4% during the first quarter, according to its most recent 
13F filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The institutional investor owned 788,025 shares of 
the transportation company's stock after purchasing an additional 388,868 shares during the quarter. Ryanair 
comprises approximately 16.6% of Metropolis Capital Ltd's portfolio, making the stock its 2nd largest holding. 
Metropolis Capital Ltd owned approximately 0.34% of Ryanair worth $59,055,000 as of its most recent SEC filing.

Apr 06, 2019( Watchlist News: http://www.watchlistnews.com/ Delivered by Newstex)             
https://www.marketbeat.com/logos/ryanair-holdings-plc-logo.jpgHSBC cut shares of Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) 
from a buy rating to a hold rating in a report published on Tuesday, 24/7 WallStreet[1] reports. The brokerage 
currently has $73.00 target price on the transportation company's stock.RYAAY has been the topic of a number of 
other reports. 
Morgan Stanley cut shares of Ryanair from an overweight rating to an equal weight rating in a report on Tuesday, 
January 22nd. Berenberg Bank cut shares of Ryanair from a hold rating to a sell rating in a report on Tuesday, 
January 8th. Cantor Fitzgerald raised shares of Ryanair from a hold rating to a buy rating in a report on 
Wednesday, February 6th. Societe Generale raised shares of Ryanair from a hold rating to a buy rating in a report 
on Tuesday, February 19th. Finally, Raymond James raised shares of Ryanair from a market perform rating to an 
outperform rating and set a $85.00 target price on the stock in a report on Wednesday, January 30th. They noted 
that the move was a valuation call. Four equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, five have 
assigned a hold rating and six have given a buy rating to the stock. The company has a consensus rating of Hold 
and a consensus target price of $78.00.RYAAY[2] opened at $73.94 on Tuesday. The firm has a market 
capitalization of $17.61 billion, a P/E ratio of 12.05 and a beta of 0.73. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 
0.68, a quick ratio of 0.91 and a current ratio of 0.91. Ryanair has a 12-month low of $65.61 and a 12-month high of 
$124.33. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its quarterly earnings results on Monday, February 4th. The 
transportation company reported ($0.10) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the consensus estimate 
of $0.25 by ($0.35). The company had revenue of $1.80 billion during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of 
$1.80 billion. Ryanair had a net margin of 14.65% and a return on equity of 25.18%. As a group, equities research 
analysts anticipate that Ryanair will post 5.94 EPS for the current fiscal year. Several large investors have recently 
modified their holdings of the business. Pinnacle Bank acquired a new stake in shares of Ryanair in the 4th quarter 
worth about $31,000. Quadrant Capital Group LLC increased its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 2,727.3% in the 
4th quarter. Quadrant Capital Group LLC now owns 933 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$65,000 after acquiring an additional 900 shares during the period. BRITISH COLUMBIA INVESTMENT 
MANAGEMENT Corp acquired a new stake in shares of Ryanair in the 4th quarter worth about $84,000. We Are 
One Seven LLC acquired a new stake in shares of Ryanair in the 4th quarter worth about $116,000. Finally, 
NumerixS Investment Technologies Inc increased its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 171.4% in the 4th quarter. 
NumerixS Investment Technologies Inc now owns 1,900 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$136,000 after acquiring an additional 1,200 shares during the period. 43.69% of the stock is currently owned by 
institutional investors. Ryanair Company ProfileRyanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides 
HSBC Downgrades Ryanair (RYAAY) to Hold
scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company 
is also involved in the provision of various ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-
related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, 
holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.Featured Story: Fundamental Analysis - How It Helps

CONSUMER SERVICES SECTOR REVIEW: easyJet Posts Warning, Wizz Air Soars
CONSUMER SERVICES SECTOR REVIEW: easyJet Posts Warning, Wizz Air 
Soars
Live Briefs PRO Global Markets
April 5, 2019 Friday 7:40 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 1081 words
Body
 Airlines were in the spotlight this week after easyJet guided for a "significantly" widened interim loss and Wizz Air 
said its annual profit will land at the upper end of guidance. 
easyJet started off the week on Monday saying that macroeconomic and Brexit uncertainty would lead to a softer 
second half and a significantly widened interim loss.
For the six months to March-end, easyJet expects to report a headline pretax loss of around GBP275 million due to 
higher costs, fuel and foreign exchange charges. This compares to a headline loss of GBP18 million a year ago.
First-half revenue however is expected to rise 7.3% to GBP2.34 billion.
Looking ahead, the budget airline warned that the second half outlook is now even "more cautious" due to 
macroeconomic uncertainty leading to softness in both the UK and Europe.
Brexit uncertainty did not seem to affect smaller peer Wizz Air however, which on Tuesday reported further traffic 
growth in March and said annual profit would come in towards the top of its guidance.
The central and eastern Europe-focused airline said net profit for the year ended March 31 is expected to come in 
towards the upper half of the EUR270 million and EUR300 million guidance range. A year ago, Wizz Air's net profit 
amounted to EUR275 million.
This was after fourth quarter trading in line with expectations and "robust" demand across the company's key 
geographical territories, Wizz Air explained. 
In March, Wizz Air passenger numbers rose 9.9% to 2.7 million. On a rolling 12 months basis, passenger numbers 
increased 17% to 34.6 million.
CONSUMER SERVICES SECTOR REVIEW: easyJet Posts Warning, Wizz Air Soars
Meanwhile, another airline heavyweight, Ryanair Holdings, said March passenger numbers rose 9.0% to 10.9 
million. On a rolling annual basis, Ryanair's traffic was also up 9.0% to 142.1 million. 
Elsewhere, trouble continued across the retail sector with data released Friday suggesting that Mother's Day and 
warm spring weather failed to provide respite for the struggling UK high street in March.
A mere 4.8% rise in sales failed to counterbalance last March's dire 10% fall, the BDO's High Street Sales Tracker 
showed.
The latest figures closed a "disastrous" first quarter for the high street, BDO said.
Meanwhile, UK shop prices continued to rise in March, the British Retail Consortium-Nielsen Shop Price Index 
showed on Wednesday, with annual shop price inflation accelerating to 0.9% from 0.7% in February, marking the 
highest inflation rate since 2013.
Some retailers have continued to take advantage of the tough trading climate by hunting for cut-price deals.
FTSE 250 retailer JD Sports Fashion on Thursday bought Oasis singer Liam Gallagher's clothing brand Pretty 
Green out of administration for an undisclosed sum. 
JD Sports will keep the flagship store in Manchester open, but will shut down 11 other stores and 33 concessions, 
putting 97 jobs at risk.
Additionally, last month JD agreed to acquire shoe retailer Footasylum for GBP90.1 million.
Also looking to snap up businesses, Sports Direct International offered to acquire home shopping retailer Findel for 
GBP139.2 million. 
Findel however urged its shareholders to reject Sports Direct proposed takeover as it believes the offer 
"undervalues" the business.
On Monday, Findel received a letter from its second largest shareholder, Schroders Investment Management, 
supporting the company in its rejection of the offer.
Sports Direct's pursuit of taking over struggling department store chain operator Debenhams also continued with 
Sports Direct saying Monday that it has been contacted by a number of Debenhams' shareholders expressing 
support for the sports retailer's board requisition action. 
Sports Direct said Debenhams shareholders expressed concern regarding the protection of their own interests amid 
a refinancing of Debenhams and stated their support for the appointment of Sports Direct's boss Mike Ashley to 
Debenhams board as chief executive.
In March, Sports Direct called for a general meeting of Debenhams to propose Ashley's appointment to the board to 
carry out an executive role. Furthermore, Sports Direct is looking to oust all Debenhams directors bar one.
In a separate attempt to take control of Debenhams, Sports Direct has made a GBP61.4 million bid for the 
department store chain.
Women fashion retailer Bonmarche on Tuesday also found itself as the object of a takeover offer by Spectre 
Holdings Ltd, owned by Edinburgh Woollen Mill billionaire owner Philip Day.
The offer is priced at 11.445 pence per share and values the company at GBP5.7 million, a 34% discount to 
Bonmarche's GBP8.7 million market value Monday's close. 
Meanwhile, on Tuesday Superdry's co-founder and former chief executive Julian Dunkerton narrowly won a 
shareholder vote marking his return to the company's board. 
CONSUMER SERVICES SECTOR REVIEW: easyJet Posts Warning, Wizz Air Soars
Superdry's shareholders voted in favour of two special resolutions proposed by the retailer's co-founders, which 
resulted in Dunkerton's reappointment and the appointment of Boohoo group's Peter Williams as director.
As a result of the votes, Superdry's Chair Peter Bamford, Chief Executive Euan Sutherland and Chief Financial 
Officer Ed Barker have stepped down with immediate effect, while Non-Executive Directors Dennis Millard, Minnow 
Powell, Sarah Wood and John Smith will leave their roles on July 1.
Finally, the Food retail sector saw Asda kicking out J Sainsbury taking the spot of the second biggest UK 
supermarket by market share, according to figures released by Kantar on Tuesday. 
Asda, in the 12 weeks to March 24, saw sales up by a miniscule 0.1% but reached market share of 15.4%. Over the 
same period, Sainsbury's sales dropped 1.8%, with market share down to 15.3%. 
Wm Morrison Supermarkets was the only other grocer seeing a decline in sales, dipping 0.1%, with its market share 
at 10.3%. Tesco saw sales up 0.5%, but its market share shed 0.2 percentage point to 27.4%. 
Overall, UK supermarkets saw sales up 1.4% year-on-year, the slowest rate in a year due to the later timing of 
Easter and Mother's Day.
A strong performance from its Food division helped Co-operative Group increasing annual pretax profit by 27% to 
GBP93 million. Revenue rose 14% to GBP10.2 billion the company said Friday. 
On Wednesday next week, UK biggest supermarket Tesco is out with its annual results. The grocer is expected to 
show a 22% surge in pretax profit to GBP1.6 billion.
On the same day, another retail heavyweight ASOS will publish its interim results with analysts forecasting a drop in 
profit to GBP3.5 million from GBP27.3 million a year ago. 
Load-Date: April 6, 2019

Jane Street Group LLC Has $852,000 Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY )
Jane Street Group LLC Has $852,000 Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc 
(RYAAY)
DailyPolitical
April 5, 2019 Friday 11:06 AM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 776 words
Body
Apr 05, 2019( DailyPolitical: http://www.dailypolitical.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Jane Street Group LLC grew its 
position in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 389.6% in the fourth quarter, according to the 
company in its most recent 13F filing with the SEC. The fund owned 11,942 shares of the transportation company's 
stock after buying an additional 9,503 shares during the quarter. Jane Street Group LLC's holdings in Ryanair were 
worth $852,000 as of its most recent filing with the SEC. 
A number of other institutional investors have also recently made changes to their positions in RYAAY. Comerica 
Bank increased its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 6.7% in the 3rd quarter. Comerica Bank now owns 16,139 
shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $1,343,000 after purchasing an additional 1,008 shares in 
the last quarter. JPMorgan Chase .... increased its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 17.3% in the 3rd quarter. 
JPMorgan Chase .... now owns 1,983,410 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $190,487,000 
after purchasing an additional 293,233 shares in the last quarter. Alliancebernstein L.P. increased its holdings in 
shares of Ryanair by 33.9% in the 3rd quarter. Alliancebernstein L.P. now owns 8,400 shares of the transportation 
company's stock valued at $807,000 after purchasing an additional 2,127 shares in the last quarter. Bank of New 
York Mellon Corp increased its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 281.8% in the 3rd quarter. Bank of New York 
Mellon Corp now owns 135,340 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $12,998,000 after 
purchasing an additional 99,891 shares in the last quarter. Finally, PNC Financial Services Group Inc. increased its 
holdings in shares of Ryanair by 95.5% in the 3rd quarter. PNC Financial Services Group Inc. now owns 5,358 
shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $515,000 after purchasing an additional 2,617 shares in the 
last quarter. Institutional investors own 43.69% of the company's stock. RYAAY has been the subject of several 
recent research reports. Raymond James upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "market perform" rating to an 
"outperform" rating and set a $85.00 target price for the company in a report on Wednesday, January 30th. They 
noted that the move was a valuation call. ValuEngine[1] downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a 
"strong sell" rating in a report on Tuesday, January 15th. Societe Generale upgraded shares of Ryanair from a 
"hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on Tuesday, February 19th. BidaskClub downgraded shares of Ryanair 
from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Tuesday, December 11th. Finally, Berenberg Bank downgraded 
shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "sell" rating in a report on Tuesday, January 8th. Four analysts have 
rated the stock with a sell rating, five have assigned a hold rating and six have given a buy rating to the company. 
Ryanair currently has an average rating of "Hold" and a consensus price target of $78.00.NASDAQ:RYAAY[2] 
opened at $75.20 on Friday. The company has a quick ratio of 0.91, a current ratio of 0.91 and a debt-to-equity ratio 
of 0.68. Ryanair Holdings plc has a twelve month low of $65.61 and a twelve month high of $124.68. The stock has 
Jane Street Group LLC Has $852,000 Holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY )
a market cap of $17.35 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 10.67 and a beta of 0.73. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last 
posted its earnings results on Monday, February 4th. The transportation company reported ($0.10) earnings per 
share for the quarter, missing the Thomson Reuters' consensus estimate of $0.25 by ($0.35). Ryanair had a net 
margin of 14.65% and a return on equity of 25.18%. The business had revenue of $1.80 billion for the quarter, 
compared to analysts' expectations of $1.80 billion. On average, research analysts forecast that Ryanair Holdings 
plc will post 5.72 EPS for the current year.  About RyanairRyanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, 
provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The 
company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and 
Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation 
services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.Further Reading: What are gap-up stocks?[3] [

Apr 05, 2019( Transcript Daily: https://transcriptdaily.com Delivered by Newstex)  Pinnacle Bank purchased a new 
position in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) during the fourth quarter, according to its most recent 
disclosure with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The firm purchased 430 shares of the 
transportation company's stock, valued at approximately $31,000. Other large investors have also added to or 
reduced their stakes in the company. Quadrant Capital Group LLC grew its stake in Ryanair by 2,727.3% during the 
fourth quarter. Quadrant Capital Group LLC now owns 933 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$65,000 after buying an additional 900 shares in the last quarter. 
BRITISH COLUMBIA INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT Corp acquired a new stake in Ryanair during the fourth 
quarter worth about $84,000. We Are One Seven LLC acquired a new stake in Ryanair during the fourth quarter 
worth about $116,000. NumerixS Investment Technologies Inc grew its stake in Ryanair by 171.4% during the 
fourth quarter. NumerixS Investment Technologies Inc now owns 1,900 shares of the transportation company's 
stock worth $136,000 after buying an additional 1,200 shares in the last quarter. Finally, Raymond James Trust 
N.A. grew its stake in Ryanair by 9.3% during the fourth quarter. Raymond James Trust N.A. now owns 2,858 
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $204,000 after buying an additional 244 shares in the last 
quarter. 43.69% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors and hedge funds. A number of equities 
research analysts have recently weighed in on the stock. ValuEngine[1] upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "strong 
sell" rating to a "sell" rating in a research note on Monday. HSBC downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating 
to a "hold" rating and set a $73.00 price target on the stock. in a research note on Tuesday. Zacks Investment 
Research[2] upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a "buy" rating and set a $83.00 price target on 
the stock in a research note on Tuesday, December 11th. BidaskClub upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "sell" 
rating to a "hold" rating in a research note on Thursday, February 28th. Finally, Raymond James upgraded shares 
of Ryanair from a "market perform" rating to an "outperform" rating and set a $85.00 price target on the stock in a 
research note on Wednesday, January 30th. They noted that the move was a valuation call. Four analysts have 
rated the stock with a sell rating, five have issued a hold rating and six have issued a buy rating to the company.

opened at $75.20 on Friday. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.68, a quick ratio of 0.91 and a current ratio 
of 0.91. Ryanair Holdings plc has a one year low of $65.61 and a one year high of $124.68. The company has a 
market cap of $17.35 billion, a P/E ratio of 10.67 and a beta of 0.73. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its 
earnings results on Monday, February 4th. The transportation company reported ($0.10) EPS for the quarter, 
missing the consensus estimate of $0.25 by ($0.35). Ryanair had a return on equity of 25.18% and a net margin of 
14.65%. The business had revenue of $1.80 billion for the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $1.80 billion.

beta of 0.73. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its earnings results on Monday, February 4th. The 
transportation company reported ($0.10) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus 
estimates of $0.25 by ($0.35). Ryanair had a net margin of 14.65% and a return on equity of 25.18%. The company 
had revenue of $1.80 billion during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $1.80 billion. On average, equities

The cap will fit perfectly for Fry in Stayers Hurdle BillEsdaile previews the remainder of tomorrow's Aintree 
action ; RACING TRADER
The cap will fit perfectly for Fry in Stayers Hurdle; BillEsdaile previews the 
remainder of tomorrow's Aintree action ; RACING TRADER
City A.M.
April 5, 2019 Friday
Edition 1, National Edition
Copyright 2019 City A.M. All Rights Reserved
Section: NEWS; Pg. 37
Length: 633 words
Byline: Bill Esdaile
Body
WHILE the majority of the country will only care about the Grand National tomorrow from a racing perspective, 
punters will be just as interested in the undercard.
The second biggest race of the day is the Ryanair Stayers Hurdle (3.40pm), where Apple's Jade will try to bounce 
back from a disappointing performance in last month's Champion Hurdle.
That was the second year in a row she has disappointed at Prestbury Park, although there was an excuse as she 
scoped dirty after the race.
Prior to that effort she had been absolutely brilliant this season and she is sure to attract plenty of support.
The question you have to ask yourself is whether you're willing to forgive that run just three and a half weeks ago.
At a general 7/4 I'm not and I would rather back Harry Fry's IF THE CAP FITS each-way at 6/1 with Betfair.
Aintree has been the plan for this horse all season, in either this race or the 2m4f Aintree Hurdle yesterday.
In all his runs this season, the son of Milan has shaped like a real stayer and Fry has decided to apply a pair of 
cheekpieces for the first time.
Last time at Fontwell, he raced very lazily and actually did remarkably well to finish as close to Vision Des Flos as 
he did.
The cap will fit perfectly for Fry in Stayers Hurdle BillEsdaile previews the remainder of tomorrow's Aintree 
action ; RACING TRADER
The combination of the step up in trip and headgear may well work the oracle and he is one of very few unexposed 
horses in this field.
Sam Spinner returned to form at Cheltenham, but he has to follow that up here, while Roksana was a fortunate 
winner of the Mares' Hurdle.
The card gets underway with the Gaskells Handicap Hurdle (1.45pm), a hugely competitive 3m½f handicap hurdle.
We won't know the final declara-tions until later this morning, but Gordon Elliott could have a powerful hand with the 
likes of Sire Du Berlais, Dallas Des Pictons and Defi Bleu all entered.
However, we saw at Cheltenham in a number of the handicaps that the cream often rises to the top which draws 
me to the chances of AUX PTIT SOINS.
Dan Skelton's nine-year-old absolutely bolted up in a handicap hurdle at Cheltenham on New Year's Day, a 
performance which saw him sent off just 9/2 for the Cleeve Hurdle.
He disappointed in that, but a mistake two out didn't help and he will appreciate the drop back to handicap 
company.
The Skelton yard continues to fire on all cylinders and 14/1 with Betfair looks a more than fair each-way price.
Lalor has won at this meeting for the last two years, so he has to be greatly respected in the Doom Bar Maghull 
Novices' Chase (3.00pm).
The problem is he ran so badly in the Arkle that it requires a massive leap of faith to back him here at a best price 
4/1 with Coral.
Us And Them stayed on to take second in that race, but I could see one or two having too much speed for him.
I'm hoping one is CLONDAW CASTLE as he travelled brilliantly coming down the hill in the Arkle only to find the 
stamina-sapping climb back up it a bridge too far.
I loved the way he jumped that day and it has to be significant that Tom George is willing to forego a handicap mark 
of 144 for the second time and go for another Grade One.
George's horses are in great form and he tends to do well at this meeting, so Clondaw Castle is the selection at 4/1 
with Ladbrokes. Tim Vaughan won the Betway Handicap Chase (4.20pm) in 2012 with Saint Are and he can repeat 
the trick with DEBECE tomorrow.
The Welsh handler has never hidden his admiration for this horse who was third to The World's End in the Grade 
One Sefton Novices' Hurdle at this meeting two years ago.
He has won two of his three starts over fences and you get the feeling this has been the plan. Take the 9/1 with 
Ladbrokes.
@BillEsdaile POINTERS TOMORROW Aux Ptit Soins e/w 1.45pm Aintree Clondaw Castle 3.00pm Aintree If The 
Cap Fits e/w 3.40pm Aintree Debece e/w 4.20pm Aintree If The Cap Fits should relish the step up in trip in the 
Stayers Hurdle
Load-Date: April 5, 2019

Citywire
April 4, 2019 Thursday 4:21 AM GMT
Copyright 2019 Citywire Financial Publishers All Rights Reserved

Carney warns.
Body
Top stories
•
The Times: Theresa May and Jeremy Corbyn were both facing an angry revolt from their parties last night 
amid mounting scepticism over the prospects of their talks finding a way through Brexit.
•

“accidental disorderly Brexit” was “alarmingly high” as politicians cannot decide what kind of deal they 
want.
•

fated investments in recent years; Zeina Bain, one of the private equity group’s senior female executives in 
the continent, has left.
•
Financial Times: Oxford Nanopore, the gene analysis company, is planning a stock market listing within 12 
months.
•
Financial Times: Renault has publicly accused Carlos Ghosn of “questionable and concealed practices” 
and violating the company’s ethics.
Business and economics
•
The Guardian: The International Monetary Fund’s World Economic Outlook report has cautioned that rising 
market power among a few firms threatens to stifle innovation and make it harder for central banks to deal 
with recessions.
•
Daily Mail: AA’s profits plunged last year as the breakdown service ploughed more money into road patrols 
and a digital turnaround plan.
•
The Daily Telegraph: Banco Santander has said that it was targeting €1.2 billion of annual cost saving and 
planned to pump over €20 billion in technology investments over the next four years.
•
The Guardian: Citadel Europe, the hedge fund founded by the billionaire investor Ken Griffin, has made a 
£60 million bet that the share price of Ryanair will fall.

transport group revealed on Wednesday.

rules and tough trading conditions.

Superdry, are trying to calm nerves after a boardroom coup which has wiped nearly £70 million off the 
fashion brand’s market value.

who will take over when Mike Turner leaves after its AGM in July.

The Times: Matthew Roberts, the finance boss at Intu Properties, is in line to be promoted to the top job 
running Britain’s largest shopping centre developer.

The Times: Dechra Pharmaceuticals said that Richard Cotton, its chief financial officer since January 2017, 
was stepping down with immediate effect for personal reasons.

Financial Times: The number of cigarette packs sold in the US dropped sharply in March, intensifying Wall 
Street concerns that smokers are shifting to vaping.

The Daily Telegraph: Britain is "definitively" a better place to do business than France, the French chief 
executive of Europe's largest online furniture retailer Made.com has claimed.

campaigners that overturns a “draconian” injunction against shale gas protests.

meter rollout last year.

former KPMG manager to review the audit division of the Big Four firm.
•

in a move to help keep the technology relevant by encouraging competitors to enter the market.

Ryanair launches new base at London Southend Airport
Ryanair launches new base at London Southend Airport
MarketLine NewsWire (Formerly Datamonitor)
April 4, 2019 Thursday 12:00 AM GMT
Copyright 2019 MarketLine All Rights Reserved
Section: AUTOMOTIVE, TRANSPORT AND LOGISTICS
Length: 211 words
Highlight: Ryanair has officially opened its new base at London Southend Airport, the fourth busiest in Britain.
Body
The Irish low-cost airline has deployed three aircraft with an investment of $300m in Southend, Essex. It will fly over 
50 aircraft per week to 13 destinations in eight countries.The opening of the new base has enabled the airline to 
support 750 'on-site' jobs at London Southend Airport.Stobart Group, which owns Southend Airport along with 
Stobart Air, is looking to capitalise on congestion at other airports in London.Stobart Aviation CEO Glyn Jones, said: 
"We are delighted to welcome the first Ryanair flight to London Southend Airport today. Ryanair passengers can 
now fly to 14 new routes and enjoy a quick and easy airport with direct trains to London Liverpool Street in 51 
minutes."This is an exciting time for London Southend Airport. We welcomed 1.5million passengers last year. With 
the arrival of Ryanair, we will be welcoming over 2.5 million."We are growing fast. We believe we can maintain this 
momentum with more airlines recognising that we represent an attracting destination for growth in London."In 2008, 
Stobart Group acquired London Southend Airport and applied to increase the runway by 300m and also upgrade 
navigation and lighting systems.The airport operator opened a new art air traffic control tower and mainline railway 
station in 2011.
Load-Date: April 10, 2019
End of Document
Ryanair ( RYAAY ) Given Coverage Optimism Rating of -1.89
Ryanair (RYAAY) Given Coverage Optimism Rating of -1.89
American Banking and Market News
April 3, 2019 Wednesday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 577 words
Body
Ryanair logo Media coverage about Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) has trended somewhat negative recently, InfoTrie 
reports. InfoTrie identifies positive and negative media coverage by reviewing more than 6,000 news and blog 
sources in real-time. The firm ranks coverage of public companies on a scale of negative five to positive five, with 
scores nearest to five being the most favorable. Ryanair earned a media sentiment score of -1.89 on their scale. 
InfoTrie also gave news articles about the transportation company an news buzz score of 10 out of 10, meaning 
that recent media coverage is extremely likely to have an effect on the company's share price in the next few days.  
These are some of the news headlines that may have impacted Ryanair's analysis: 
•
Shannon announces twice-weekly Ryanair flights to Ibiza and East Midlands - Limerick Post  
(limerickpost.ie)
•
First ever Exeter Ryanair flight lands at city airport - Devon Live  (devonlive.com)
•
UPDATE 1-Ryanair pilots in Portugal vote for pay agreement - Reuters  (reuters.com)
•
Ryanair flies 10.5 million passengers in March, opens new base at Southend - Kiwi.com  (kiwi.com)
•
Ryanair Announces Plans to Launch Cheap Flights to Space - Travel+Leisure  (travelandleisure.com)
RYAAY stock  opened at $72.55 on Wednesday. The firm has a market cap of $17.59 billion, a PE ratio of 10.29 
and a beta of 0.73. Ryanair has a 52-week low of $65.61 and a 52-week high of $124.68. The company has a quick 
ratio of 0.91, a current ratio of 0.91 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.68.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last released its quarterly earnings results on Monday, February 4th. The transportation 
company reported ($0.10) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the Thomson Reuters' consensus 
estimate of $0.25 by ($0.35). The business had revenue of $1.80 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus 
estimate of $1.80 billion. Ryanair had a net margin of 14.65% and a return on equity of 25.18%.  On average, 
research analysts predict that  Ryanair will post 5.72 EPS for the current year.  
A number of research analysts have issued reports on the stock. HSBC lowered shares of Ryanair from a "buy" 
rating to a "hold" rating and set a $73.00 target price on the stock. in a research report on Tuesday. ValuEngine  
raised shares of Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a "sell" rating in a report on Monday. BidaskClub downgraded

About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Ryanair traffic soars sky-high despite difficult full-year results
Ryanair traffic soars sky-high despite difficult full-year results
City A.M.
April 3, 2019 Wednesday
Edition 1, National Edition
Copyright 2019 City A.M. All Rights Reserved
Section: NEWS; Pg. 13
Length: 108 words
Byline: JESS CLARK
Body
RYANAIR's traffic grew nine per cent year-on-year last month as passenger numbers hit 10.9m in March.
Traffic is nine per cent up overall so far this year, with the rolling annual total at 132.1m, up from 130.3m in the year 
to March 2018.
However, growth slowed in comparison to February, when passenger numbers increased by 13 per cent, leading 
shares to dip.
The budget airline swung to a loss in the third quarter of its financial year, blaming the poor performance on weaker 
ticket prices.
Last month, chief executive Michael O'Leary announced he will step back from the day-to-day running of the budget 
airline, giving the company a chance to "reboot".

European ADRs in Tuesday Trading
European ADRs in Tuesday Trading
MT Newswires Live Briefs
April 2, 2019 Tuesday 11:16 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 231 words
Body
 Information on the Bank of New York Mellon Europe ADR Index was not available on Tuesday.
In continental Europe, the gainers were led by medical equipment maker Edap (EDAP), which soared 22%, 
followed by biopharmaceutical company Biofrontera (BFRA), 3D printer maker voxeljet (VJET), and 
biopharmaceutical company MorphoSys (MOR), which climbed 4%, 3.1%, and 2.4% respectively. 
The decliners in continental Europe were led by telecommunications operator Telecom Italia (TI), and electronics 
company Philips Electronics (PHG), which fell 3.5% and 3.2% respectively. They were followed by pharmaceutical 
company Ascendis Pharma (ASND), and health care company Novartis (NVS), which were off 1% and 0.9%.
In the UK and Ireland, the gainers were led by biopharmaceutical company Verona Pharma (VRNA), and insurance 
firm Prudential (PUK), which rose 1.9% and 1.8% respectively. They were followed by biotech company Autolus 
Therapeutics (AUTL), and biopharmaceutical firm Adaptimmune Therapeutics (ADAP), which were up 1.8% and 
1.5%.
The decliners in the UK and Ireland were led by specialty pharmaceutical firm Midatech Pharma (MTP), and 
pharmaceutical company Avadel (AVDL), which lost 5.4% and 4.9% respectively. They were followed by airline 
operator Ryanair (RYAAY), and biopharmaceutical company Motif Bio (MTFB), which dropped 3% and 1.6%.

LONDON MARKET PRE-OPEN: Edinburgh Woolen Mills' Day Bids For Bonmarche
LONDON MARKET PRE-OPEN: Edinburgh Woolen Mills' Day Bids For 
Bonmarche
Live Briefs PRO Global Markets
April 2, 2019 Tuesday 2:48 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 1079 words
Body
 Stock prices in London are seen opening higher on Tuesday following a strong close in the US overnight and gains 
in Asian equity markets, as investors reacted positively to US and Chinese manufacturing data released on 
Monday.
In company news, the spat between Provident Financial and Non-Standard Finance took another twist, BHP is 
lowering its iron ore guidance, Ryanair and Wizz Air issued upbeat trading statements, and womenswear retailer 
Bonmarche received a discounted takeover offer.
IG futures indicate the FTSE 100 index is to open up 15.02 points at 7,332.40. The blue-chip index closed up 38.19 
points, or 0.5%, at 7,317.38 on Monday.
Provident Financial said Chief Financial Officer Simon Thomas is to take up to three months leave starting on 
Friday to have a heart operation. Thomas is expected to return to work full time no later than June. The subprime 
lender said Tony Skrzypecki is to be interim CFO.
Provident Financial has been embroiled in a hostile takeover battle with John van Kuffeler's Non-Standard Finance, 
with the two companies trading barbs over the past few months. Van Kuffeler was CEO of Provident between 1991 
to 2013.
Non-Standard Finance said it has received bid acceptances from over 50% of Provident shareholders, but added 
that 90% of acceptances is required for success. 
In response, Provident reiterated its rejection of the Non-Standard Finance offer and said it continues to explore 
alternatives to maximise shareholder value.
Ryanair Holdings reported an increase in traffic for the month of March, with passenger numbers up 9% to 10.9 
million. On a rolling annual basis Ryanair's traffic was up 9% to 142.1 million. 
LONDON MARKET PRE-OPEN: Edinburgh Woolen Mills' Day Bids For Bonmarche
Smaller budget airline Wizz Air Holdings said it expects its annual profit to come in towards the top of its guidance, 
while also reporting traffic growth in March. 
Wizz Air Holdings said trading in the fourth quarter of its financial year ended on Sunday is in line with expectations. 
The central and eastern Europe-focused airline expects to deliver a net annual profit for the year in the upper half of 
its guidance range of between EUR270 million and EUR300 million. 
HSBC took a downbeat view of the airline sector, downgrading its ratings on easyJet, Ryanair and Wizz Air to Hold 
from Buy. 
Irish building materials firm CRH said it completed the fourth phase of its share buyback programme, returning a 
further EUR200 million of cash to shareholders. The company added that this brings total cash returned to 
shareholders under our share buyback programme to approximately EUR1 billion over the last 12 months.
CRH added that further share buybacks are "under active consideration".
Construction firm Galliford Try said it signed an agreement with Homes England to build more than 850 homes 
across the UK.
The housebuilder said the partnership will deliver housing across key sites in Redcar, Cheshire, Staffordshire and 
Dorset. The homes will be constructed as part of Homes England's initiative to build new housing at pace. 
Construction work will begin on the projects immediately with the first planning applications due to be submitted 
later in April and the first homes expected to be completed in spring 2020.
Miner BHP Group will be reviewing its 2019 production guidance following disruption caused by Cyclone Veronica 
in Australia.
The storm has not caused any major damage at Port Hedland in Western Australia, BHP said, but flooding has 
hampered the movement of trains. As a result, Port Hedland, part of BHP's iron ore arm, is operating at a reduced 
rate and will continue to do so until later in April.
BHP said an early estimate of the impact will see 2019 production fall by around 6 million to 8 million tonnes, and it 
is also reviewing unit cost guidance. A further update will be provided after further work is carried out, it said.
Spectre Holdings, a Dubai-registered company 100% owned by Edinburgh Woolen Mill owner Philip Day, has made 
a mandatory cash offer for clothing retailer Bonmarche after taking a 52.4% stake. The offer values Bonmarche at 
GBP5.7 million, against its GBP8.7 million current market value. Spectre pointed to a significant decline in 
Bonmarche's profitability and said it could offer advice and support.
The Japanese Nikkei 225 index ended flat. In China, the Shanghai Composite is up 0.7%, while the Hang Seng 
index in Hong Kong is up 0.2%.
In the US on Monday, Wall Street ended higher, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average and Nasdaq Composite 
both up 1.3%, while the S&P 500 ended 1.2% higher.
"Rebounding US manufacturing helped US shares advance at the start of the new quarter. The S&P 500 surged to 
its highest level since October while stocks across Asia also rallied on Tuesday, setting European indices up for a 
positive start," said London Capital Group's Jasper Lawler.
On Monday, a report from the Institute for Supply Management unexpectedly showing a faster rate of growth in US 
manufacturing activity in the month of March.
Additionally on Monday, data showed Chinese manufacturing activity unexpectedly grew for the first time in four 
months in March. A private survey also showed the manufacturing sector in the world's second-biggest economy 
returning to expansion.
LONDON MARKET PRE-OPEN: Edinburgh Woolen Mills' Day Bids For Bonmarche
"Traders are growing increasingly optimistic that the world's two largest economies are starting to stabilise, amid 
better recent data prints," Lawler said.
The pound was quoted at USD1.3065 early Tuesday, down from USD1.3118 at the London equities close Monday.
UK Prime Minister Theresa May will seek to break the Brexit deadlock as she gathers her Cabinet for a marathon 
session of crisis talks in Downing Street.
The prime minister and her senior ministers will take stock after members of Parliament again failed to find a 
majority for a series of alternatives to her Brexit deal.
A call for a customs union with the EU was rejected by just three votes, while a demand for a second referendum 
was defeated by 12 and a Norway-style deal put forward by Nick Boles by 21.
To cap a dramatic day in the Commons, Boles immediately declared that he would no longer sit as a Conservative 
MP, blaming the party for refusing to compromise on a means of leaving the EU.
Cabinet will meet on Tuesday for five hours to thrash out a way forward.
In Tuesday's economic calendar, the UK's construction PMI is at 0930 BST while eurozone producer prices are at 
1000 BST and US durable goods orders are at 1330 BST.
At 0800 BST, Kantar releases its latest grocery share figures for the 12 weeks ending March 24.

FTSE 100 Extends Gains As Brexit Deadlock Weighs On Pound
FTSE 100 Extends Gains As Brexit Deadlock Weighs On Pound
dpa-AFX International ProFeed
April 2, 2019 Tuesday 12:03 PM GMT
Copyright 2019 dpa-AFX Wirtschaftsnachrichten GmbH All Rights Reserved
Length: 205 words
Body
       BRUSSELS/FRANKFURT/PARIS (dpa-AFX) - U.K. stocks rose on Tuesday and the pound fell after lawmakers 
rejected all the options to replace Prime Minister Theresa May's divorce deal.  With a hard Brexit becoming nearly 
inevitable, the PM will hold a cabinet meeting today to plan the government's next moves.  The benchmark FTSE 
100 was up 34 points or 0.46 percent at 7,351 in opening deals after rising half a percent the previous day.   Tullow 
Oil edged up slightly and BP Plc gained half a percent as oil prices hit fresh 2019 highs on talk of more sanctions on 
Iran and further Venezuelan supply disruptions.  BHP shed 0.7 percent after lowering its iron ore production 
estimates.  G4S held steady as Britain's government ended the outsourced contract with the company to run 
Birmingham Prison.  Ryanair Holdings fell over 2 percent after reporting its passenger traffic figures for the month of 
March.   In economic releases, U.K. construction sector continued to shrink in March, albeit at a slightly slower 
pace, driven by sustained weakness in commercial work and civil engineering, survey data from IHS Markit 
showed.  The corresponding PMI rose to 49.7 from 49.5 in February, in line with economists' expectations.
