Can Ryanair soar high once again after its profit warning?
Can Ryanair soar high once again after its profit warning?
Citywire
January 29, 2019 Tuesday 10:38 AM GMT
Copyright 2019 Citywire Financial Publishers All Rights Reserved
Length: 754 words
Byline: Rudi Abdallah
Highlight: Brexit uncertainty, industrial disputes and overcapacity troubles have plagued the company, but is the 
situation as bad as it seems?
Body
Budget airline Ryanair announced a profit warning ealier this month, with chief executive Michael O’Leary blaming 
falling airfares. So, is the company grounded as an investment or can ir weather the turbulence and soar once 
more?
Prices had been expected to drop by 2% this winter but forecasts now show them plummeting by 7%. The company 
has also cut full year profits guidance by just under 10%, slashing the range from £970 million – £1.1 billion to £880 
million – £970 million.
Despite the gloomy figures, market analysts are broadly continuing to back the stock, albeit with some caveats.
Guinness European Equity Income fund investment analyst Nick Edwards remains cautiously optimistic about 
Ryanair’s future and says its future would look even better if Brexit collapsed.
‘I think Ryanair will come out alright in the end, but it’s hard to say if the underperformance is over for sure,' he said.
‘It’s a strong franchise, with high market shares. Overcapacity in European short-haul should continue to fall as 
smaller operators are squeezed out by tighter regulations and costs. No Brexit would be a plus.’
Ryanair is also exploiting other services used by travellers in a way their rivals are not, Edwards noted.
He said: ‘The 9x P/E multiple is still double the incumbents IAG and Lufthansa, but set against 25% sustainable 
return on equity that is nevertheless attractive.
‘Also the market isn’t really paying a lot of attention to the ancillary services growth at Ryanair (car hire, hotels) 
which is starting to grow quite nicely.’
Kames Capital European equities investment analyst Allan Clarke said that despite high profile disputes with 
employees, scheduling issues and tumbling fares, Ryanair can take advantage of the huge volume of passengers it 
can boast.
Can Ryanair soar high once again after its profit warning?
He argued: ‘The company’s issues with staff relations have been well publicised but deals with unions are 
progressing so we should be able to look beyond this shortly. 
‘The outlook for revenues is the main concern now, with high capacity in the European air travel market putting 
significant pressure on fares.
‘In the mid-term, this plays to Ryanair’s strengths: its key competitive advantages are on cost and sheer number of 
customers carried, meaning it can flex its muscle and put pressure on the weaker players in the market by being 
aggressive on fares.’
Investors can also look forward to Ryanair bolstering its market position as competitors fall by the wayside, Clarke 
predicted.
He said: ‘As others exit the market and capacity rationalises, I expect Ryanair to emerge in an even stronger 
competitive position from where it can work on improving the brand image and the company’s returns, making it 
look attractive at today’s valuation.’
However, the chief markets analyst at Markets.Com Neil Wilson said there will be turbulence ahead for Ryanair, as 
well as its competitors – in a time of considerable unpredictability.
Wilson said: ‘This is a problematic warning as it comes at a time of great uncertainty for the sector.
‘Ryanair delivered a profits warning that has rattled investors across the airline sector just as uncertainty over the 
outlook for carriers is at a high.
‘We note shares in Ryanair are starting to look rather cheap having declined by roughly half since August 2017, 
when the scheduling issues started.’
Wilson noted positives, such as better-than-expected traffic growth of 9% to 142 million, rising ancillary sales and 
better unit costs, but investors have been driven away by a ‘reassessment’ of the Ryanair model.
He said: ‘There is a mounting pressure on Ryanair's cost base as labour costs climb - we've seen the Mons 
ruling, union recognition and a series of cabin crew and pilot strikes.
‘This reassessment of Ryanair's low cost, high margin model has been at the heart of the reason why investors 
have steadily pulled out of the company. Today's lower guidance is a sign that a higher cost base makes it more 
problematic to maintain margins when overcapacity means lower fares.’
Nevertheless, Ryanair and other big low budget airline giants look set to gain from the sector-wide trend of mergers 
and acquisitions,  in Wilson’s view.
He said: ‘Even as demand pressures relent it is true that the sector as a whole is very adept at competing away any 
margin growth through lower fares.
‘On top of this we can add a good dose of Brexit uncertainty into the mix to suggest that this is a very uncertain 
period for airlines, albeit the largest carriers such as Ryanair, EasyJet and IAG are set to win out from sector-wide 
consolidation.’
Load-Date: January 31, 2019
End of Document
Ryanair could add one or two airlines but 'nothing big'
Ryanair could add one or two airlines but 'nothing big'
Business World (Digest)
January 29, 2019 Tuesday
Copyright 2019 Media World Ltd. All Rights Reserved
Section: WORLD
Length: 132 words
Byline: Business World
Body
Ryanair could acquire one or two smaller airlines like its separately branded Polish and Austrian units in the coming 
years, but "nothing big", Chief Executive Michael O'Leary said on Tuesday.
"You'll see in the next couple of years, I'd like to see Ryanair evolve as kind of a group of different airlines. We will 
have Ryanair based out of Ireland, you'll have Laudamotion based out of Austria, you'll have Ryanair Sun ... in 
Poland," he told a news conference.
"That will I think allow us in the next number of years to maybe add one or two other airlines. Now, nothing big but if 
there were some small-scale opportunities that popped up like the Laudamotion opportunity then we could do it," he 
said, adding that they would have to bring new bases in Europe. (Reuters)
Source: www.businessworld.ie
Load-Date: February 21, 2019
End of Document
Ryanair cabin crew in Spain vote for recognition agreement
Ryanair cabin crew in Spain vote for recognition agreement
Business World (Digest)
January 29, 2019 Tuesday
Copyright 2019 Media World Ltd. All Rights Reserved
Section: GENERAL
Length: 117 words
Byline: Business World
Body
Ireland-based carrier Ryanair said on Tuesday its cabin crew in Spain had voted in favour of a recognition 
agreement with SITCPLA and USO workers' unions.
Ryanair suffered a number of strikes last year by pilots and cabin crew, forcing it to cancel hundreds of flights 
across Europe, after the airline recognised unions for the first time in 2017.
The airline and the unions are working on a collective labour agreement which they both hope to conclude on or 
before April 30, Ryanair said in a statement.
Unions representing the cabin crew in Spain had called off plans to strike Jan. 10 and Jan. 13 after reaching a 
preliminary agreement on contracts earlier this month. (Reuters)
Source: www.businessworld.ie
Load-Date: February 21, 2019
End of Document

Brokerages Set Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY) Price Target at $76.00
Brokerages Set Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY) Price Target at $76.00
Watchlist News
January 28, 2019 Monday 5:06 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 690 words
Body
Jan 28, 2019( Watchlist News: http://www.watchlistnews.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) has been assigned a consensus rating of "Hold" from the fourteen brokerages that are 
presently covering the company, Marketbeat[1] reports. Four investment analysts have rated the stock with a sell 
recommendation, five have assigned a hold recommendation and four have issued a buy recommendation on the 
company. The average twelve-month target price among analysts that have issued ratings on the stock in the last 
year is $76.00. Several research analysts have issued reports on the stock. 
BidaskClub raised shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on Friday, November 23rd. 
ValuEngine[2] cut shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "strong sell" rating in a report on Tuesday, October 
2nd. Macquarie assumed coverage on shares of Ryanair in a report on Tuesday, November 27th. They set an 
"underperform" rating for the company. TheStreet cut shares of Ryanair from a "b-" rating to a "c+" rating in a report 
on Thursday, November 15th. Finally, Zacks Investment Research[3] raised shares of Ryanair from a "strong sell" 
rating to a "buy" rating and set a $83.00 price objective for the company in a report on Tuesday, December 
11th.Ryanair stock[4] traded down $1.34 during trading hours on Friday, hitting $68.62. The stock had a trading 
volume of 4,401 shares, compared to its average volume of 866,071. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 
0.62, a quick ratio of 1.25 and a current ratio of 1.25. The stock has a market capitalization of $16.39 billion, a PE 
ratio of 9.92 and a beta of 0.89. Ryanair has a 12-month low of $65.61 and a 12-month high of $127.61. Several 
institutional investors and hedge funds have recently added to or reduced their stakes in RYAAY. Intact Investment 
Management Inc. grew its position in Ryanair by 4.5% during the fourth quarter. Intact Investment Management Inc. 
now owns 6,900 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $492,000 after buying an additional 300 
shares during the period. Panagora Asset Management Inc. grew its position in Ryanair by 1.9% during the third 
quarter. Panagora Asset Management Inc. now owns 35,328 shares of the transportation company's stock valued 
at $3,393,000 after buying an additional 670 shares during the period. Voya Investment Management LLC boosted 
its position in shares of Ryanair by 35.2% in the second quarter. Voya Investment Management LLC now owns 
2,975 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $340,000 after purchasing an additional 775 shares 
during the period. Freestone Capital Holdings LLC boosted its position in shares of Ryanair by 17.2% in the third 
quarter. Freestone Capital Holdings LLC now owns 5,355 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$514,000 after purchasing an additional 785 shares during the period. Finally, Advisors Asset Management Inc. 
boosted its position in shares of Ryanair by 10.9% in the third quarter. Advisors Asset Management Inc. now owns 
8,440 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $811,000 after purchasing an additional 832 shares 
during the period. 43.55% of the stock is owned by hedge funds and other institutional investors. About 
RyanairRyanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in

Ireland, the United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of 
various ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of 
beverages, food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel

Ryanair announces new Manchester route to Poitiers
Ryanair announces new Manchester route to Poitiers
MarketLine NewsWire (Formerly Datamonitor)
January 28, 2019 Monday 12:00 AM GMT
Copyright 2019 MarketLine All Rights Reserved
Section: AUTOMOTIVE, TRANSPORT AND LOGISTICS
Length: 236 words
Highlight: Ryanair has announced a new Manchester route to Poitiers, with a twice weekly service commencing in 
June, as part of Ryanairs Manchester Summer 2019 schedule.
Body
Ryanair’s Manchester Summer schedule now includes 64 routes in total with 9 new routes to Bordeaux, Billund, 
Gothenburg, Kyiv, Marrakech, Marseille, Nantes, Poitiers and Thessaloniki, which will deliver over 5.4m customers 
through Manchester Airport this year.Manchester consumers and visitors can now enjoy even lower fares and the 
latest “Always Getting Better” improvements including:Even more Routes, flights and destinationsRyanair Rooms 
with 10% off Travel Credit‘Try Somewhere New’ – travel content platform on Ryanair.comRyanair’s Robin Kiely 
said:“Ryanair is pleased to announce a new Manchester route to Poitiers, commencing in June, which will operate 
twice weekly, as part of our extended Manchester summer 2019 schedule. To celebrate we are releasing seats for 
sale on this new route from only &pound;26.99 for travel between June and August. This offer is available for 
booking until midnight Wednesday (30 Jan). Since these amazing low fares will be snapped up quickly, customers 
should log onto www.ryanair.com and avoid missing out.” Stephen Turner, Commercial Director at Manchester 
Airport, said:“It’s great to see Ryanair continuing to add new routes from Manchester for Summer. Poitiers is 
another French destination for the airport opening up a fantastic region for the 22 million people in our catchment 
area to explore.”
Load-Date: February 4, 2019
End of Document

Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY ) Receives Consensus Recommendation of 'Hold' from Analysts
Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY) Receives Consensus Recommendation of 
'Hold' from Analysts
Transcript Daily
January 25, 2019 Friday 7:06 AM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 759 words
Body
Jan 25, 2019( Transcript Daily: https://transcriptdaily.com Delivered by Newstex)  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) has received a consensus recommendation of "Hold" from the fourteen brokerages that are 
currently covering the company, Marketbeat.com[1] reports. Four equities research analysts have rated the stock 
with a sell rating, five have issued a hold rating and four have given a buy rating to the company. The average 
twelve-month price target among analysts that have updated their coverage on the stock in the last year is $76.00. 
A number of research firms have weighed in on RYAAY. 
BidaskClub raised shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Tuesday, October 9th. 
Morgan Stanley cut shares of Ryanair from an "overweight" rating to an "equal weight" rating in a report on 
Tuesday. Zacks Investment Research[2] reissued a "hold" rating on shares of Ryanair in a report on Monday, 
December 31st. ValuEngine[3] cut shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "strong sell" rating in a report on 
Tuesday, October 2nd. Finally, Berenberg Bank cut shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "sell" rating in a 
report on Tuesday, January 8th.Several institutional investors and hedge funds have recently made changes to

https://www.marketbeat.com/logos/ryanair-holdings-plc-logo.jpgHSBC 
upgraded 
shares 
of 
Ryanair 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) from a reduce rating to a buy rating in a research note published on Tuesday, Marketbeat 
Ratings[1] reports.A number of other brokerages also recently commented on RYAAY. BidaskClub upgraded 
shares of Ryanair from a strong sell rating to a sell rating in a research report on Saturday, September 29th. 
ValuEngine[2] downgraded shares of Ryanair from a sell rating to a strong sell rating in a research report on 
Tuesday, October 2nd. Macquarie started coverage on shares of Ryanair in a report on Tuesday, November 27th. 
They issued an underperform rating for the company. TheStreet downgraded shares of Ryanair from a b- rating to a 
c+ rating in a report on Thursday, November 15th. Finally, Zacks Investment Research[3] upgraded shares of 
Ryanair from a strong sell rating to a buy rating and set a $83.00 price target for the company in a report on 
Tuesday, December 11th. Four research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, five have issued a hold 
rating and four have issued a buy rating to the company. Ryanair currently has a consensus rating of Hold and a 
consensus target price of $76.00.Shares of Ryanair stock[4] opened at $68.47 on Tuesday. The firm has a market 
cap of $16.18 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 9.71 and a beta of 0.89. The company has a quick ratio of 1.25, a 
current ratio of 1.25 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.62. Ryanair has a one year low of $65.61 and a one year high of 
$127.61. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, October 22nd. The 
transportation company reported $4.42 EPS for the quarter, missing the Zacks' consensus estimate of $4.62 by 
($0.20). The firm had revenue of $3.21 billion for the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $3.22 billion. 
Ryanair had a return on equity of 27.63% and a net margin of 17.13%. On average, equities research analysts 
forecast that Ryanair will post 5.72 earnings per share for the current year. A number of hedge funds and other 
institutional investors have recently bought and sold shares of RYAAY. Quadrant Capital Group LLC raised its stake 
in shares of Ryanair by 2,727.3% during the fourth quarter. Quadrant Capital Group LLC now owns 933 shares of 
the transportation company's stock valued at $65,000 after purchasing an additional 900 shares during the period. 
We Are One Seven LLC purchased a new stake in shares of Ryanair during the fourth quarter valued at 
approximately $116,000. Raymond James Trust N.A. purchased a new stake in shares of Ryanair during the third 
quarter valued at approximately $251,000. Victory Capital Management Inc. purchased a new stake in shares of 
Ryanair during the third quarter valued at approximately $278,000. Finally, Voya Investment Management LLC 
raised its stake in shares of Ryanair by 35.2% during the second quarter. Voya Investment Management LLC now 
owns 2,975 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $340,000 after purchasing an additional 775 
shares during the period. Hedge funds and other institutional investors own 43.59% of the company's stock. 
Ryanair Company ProfileRyanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline

provision of various ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight

Jan 25, 2019( Transcript Daily: https://transcriptdaily.com Delivered by Newstex)  JPMorgan Chase .... increased its 
holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 17.3% in the third quarter, according to the company in its 
most recent disclosure with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The firm owned 1,983,410 shares of 
the transportation company's stock after acquiring an additional 293,233 shares during the quarter. JPMorgan 
Chase .... owned approximately 0.85% of Ryanair worth $190,487,000 as of its most recent SEC filing. A number of 
other large investors have also added to or reduced their stakes in the stock.

Management LLC now owns 2,975 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $340,000 after 
purchasing an additional 775 shares during the last quarter. Tower Research Capital LLC TRC lifted its position in

during the last quarter. Finally, Manning ...pier Group LLC lifted its position in Ryanair by 9.6% during the third

$24,412,000 after acquiring an additional 22,240 shares during the last quarter. 43.59% of the stock is owned by 
institutional investors. Several equities research analysts have issued reports on the stock. BidaskClub upgraded 
shares of Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a "sell" rating in a research report on Saturday, September 29th. 
ValuEngine[1] downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "strong sell" rating in a research report on 
Tuesday, October 2nd. Macquarie assumed coverage on shares of Ryanair in a research report on Tuesday, 
November 27th. They set an "underperform" rating for the company. TheStreet downgraded shares of Ryanair from 
a "b-" rating to a "c+" rating in a research report on Thursday, November 15th. Finally, Zacks Investment 
Research[2] upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a "buy" rating and set a $83.00 price objective 
for the company in a research report on Tuesday, December 11th. Four equities research analysts have rated the 
stock with a sell rating, five have issued a hold rating and four have assigned a buy rating to the company's stock.

$68.47 on Friday. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 12 month low of $65.61 and a 12 month high of $127.61. The 
company has a market cap of $16.18 billion, a PE ratio of 9.71 and a beta of 0.89. The company has a current ratio 
of 1.25, a quick ratio of 1.25 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.62. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its 
earnings results on Monday, October 22nd. The transportation company reported $4.42 EPS for the quarter,

missing the Thomson Reuters' consensus estimate of $4.62 by ($0.20). Ryanair had a return on equity of 27.63% 
and a net margin of 17.13%. The business had revenue of $3.21 billion for the quarter, compared to the consensus 
estimate of $3.22 billion. As a group, equities analysts predict that Ryanair Holdings plc will post 5.72 EPS for the

Ryanair ( RYAAY ) Downgraded by Morgan Stanley
Ryanair (RYAAY) Downgraded by Morgan Stanley
Transcript Daily
January 24, 2019 Thursday 7:06 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 698 words
Body
Jan 24, 2019( Transcript Daily: https://transcriptdaily.com Delivered by Newstex)  Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) was 
downgraded by Morgan Stanley from an "overweight" rating to an "equal weight" rating in a report released on 
Tuesday, MarketBeat.com[1] reports.A number of other brokerages also recently weighed in on RYAAY. 
BidaskClub raised shares of Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a "sell" rating in a report on Saturday, September 
29th. ValuEngine[2] downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "strong sell" rating in a report on 
Tuesday, October 2nd. 
TheStreet downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "b-" rating to a "c+" rating in a report on Thursday, November 15th. 
Macquarie initiated coverage on shares of Ryanair in a report on Tuesday, November 27th. They issued an 
"underperform" rating on the stock. Finally, Zacks Investment Research[3] raised shares of Ryanair from a "strong 
sell" rating to a "buy" rating and set a $83.00 price target on the stock in a report on Tuesday, December 11th. Four 
equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, five have given a hold rating and four have given a 
buy rating to the company. Ryanair currently has a consensus rating of "Hold" and an average target price of 
$76.00.Shares of NASDAQ RYAAY[4] traded down $0.62 during trading on Tuesday, hitting $69.03. The stock had 
a trading volume of 26,192 shares, compared to its average volume of 704,705. Ryanair has a 12 month low of 
$65.61 and a 12 month high of $127.61. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.62, a current ratio of 1.25 and 
a quick ratio of 1.25. The firm has a market cap of $16.18 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 9.83 and a beta of 
0.89. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its earnings results on Monday, October 22nd. The transportation 
company reported $4.42 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the Thomson Reuters' consensus 
estimate of $4.62 by ($0.20). Ryanair had a return on equity of 27.63% and a net margin of 17.13%. The firm had 
revenue of $3.21 billion during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $3.22 billion. On average, 
research analysts anticipate that Ryanair will post 5.72 EPS for the current fiscal year. A number of hedge funds 
and other institutional investors have recently added to or reduced their stakes in RYAAY. Quadrant Capital Group 
LLC lifted its holdings in Ryanair by 2,727.3% during the fourth quarter. Quadrant Capital Group LLC now owns 933 
shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $65,000 after purchasing an additional 900 shares during 
the last quarter. Raymond James Trust N.A. purchased a new stake in Ryanair during the third quarter valued at 
about $251,000. Victory Capital Management Inc. purchased a new stake in Ryanair during the third quarter valued 
at about $278,000. Voya Investment Management LLC lifted its holdings in Ryanair by 35.2% during the second 
quarter. Voya Investment Management LLC now owns 2,975 shares of the transportation company's stock valued 
at $340,000 after purchasing an additional 775 shares during the last quarter. Finally, Jane Street Group LLC 
purchased a new stake in Ryanair during the second quarter valued at about $371,000. 43.59% of the stock is 
currently owned by institutional investors and hedge funds. About RyanairRyanair Holdings plc, together with its 
Ryanair ( RYAAY ) Downgraded by Morgan Stanley
subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, and Other European 
countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled 
services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and merchandise; and marketing 
accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.Featured Story: Is a Roth IRA

Intact Investment Management Inc. Acquires 300 Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY )
Intact Investment Management Inc. Acquires 300 Shares of Ryanair Holdings 
plc (RYAAY)
DailyPolitical
January 23, 2019 Wednesday 11:05 AM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 859 words
Body
Jan 23, 2019( DailyPolitical: http://www.dailypolitical.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Intact Investment Management 
Inc. boosted its holdings in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 4.5% during the 4th quarter, according to 
the company in its most recent filing with the SEC. The institutional investor owned 6,900 shares of the 
transportation company's stock after acquiring an additional 300 shares during the quarter. 
Intact Investment Management Inc.'s holdings in Ryanair were worth $492,000 at the end of the most recent 
quarter. A number of other hedge funds and other institutional investors have also made changes to their positions 
in the stock. Capital International Investors lifted its position in Ryanair by 38.0% in the 3rd quarter. Capital 
International Investors now owns 6,143,716 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $590,042,000 
after acquiring an additional 1,693,122 shares in the last quarter. WCM Investment Management CA lifted its 
position in shares of Ryanair by 7.6% during the 3rd quarter. WCM Investment Management CA now owns 
4,161,465 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $399,666,000 after buying an additional 295,462 
shares in the last quarter. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA lifted its position in shares of Ryanair by 6.8% 
during the 3rd quarter. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA now owns 2,713,082 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $260,564,000 after buying an additional 173,885 shares in the last quarter. JPMorgan 
Chase .... lifted its position in shares of Ryanair by 17.3% during the 3rd quarter. JPMorgan Chase .... now owns 
1,983,410 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $190,487,000 after buying an additional 293,233 
shares in the last quarter. Finally, Thornburg Investment Management Inc. lifted its position in shares of Ryanair by 
4.4% during the 3rd quarter. Thornburg Investment Management Inc. now owns 1,889,740 shares of the 
transportation company's stock worth $181,491,000 after buying an additional 79,755 shares in the last quarter. 
43.59% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors and hedge funds. Shares of RYAAY stock[1] 
opened at $69.09 on Wednesday. The company has a quick ratio of 1.25, a current ratio of 1.25 and a debt-to-
equity ratio of 0.62. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 12-month low of $65.61 and a 12-month high of $127.61. The 
company has a market cap of $15.40 billion, a PE ratio of 9.80 and a beta of 0.89. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last 
issued its quarterly earnings results on Monday, October 22nd. The transportation company reported $4.42 
earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the Thomson Reuters' consensus estimate of $4.62 by ($0.20). 
Ryanair had a return on equity of 27.63% and a net margin of 17.13%. The company had revenue of $3.21 billion 
for the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $3.22 billion. Equities analysts forecast that Ryanair Holdings 
plc will post 5.72 earnings per share for the current fiscal year. Several equities analysts have commented on 
RYAAY shares. BidaskClub raised shares of Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a "sell" rating in a research report 
on Saturday, September 29th. ValuEngine[2] cut shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "strong sell" rating in a 
Intact Investment Management Inc. Acquires 300 Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY )
research report on Tuesday, October 2nd. TheStreet cut shares of Ryanair from a "b-" rating to a "c+" rating in a 
research report on Thursday, November 15th. Macquarie started coverage on shares of Ryanair in a research 
report on Tuesday, November 27th. They set an "underperform" rating on the stock. Finally, Zacks Investment 
Research[3] raised shares of Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a "buy" rating and set a $83.00 target price on 
the stock in a research report on Tuesday, December 11th. Four investment analysts have rated the stock with a 
sell rating, five have issued a hold rating and four have given a buy rating to the company's stock. Ryanair currently 
has a consensus rating of "Hold" and an average target price of $76.00.. Ryanair Company ProfileRyanair Holdings 
plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, 
and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary services, such as 
non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and merchandise; and 
marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.Further Reading:

upgraded 
shares 
of 
Ryanair 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) from a reduce rating to a buy rating in a research report report published on Tuesday,

price for the company in a research report on Tuesday, December 11th.

research report on Tuesday, January 8th. Four research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, five have 
given a hold rating and four have issued a buy rating to the company. Ryanair presently has an average rating of

quick ratio of 1.25, a current ratio of 1.25 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.62. The stock has a market cap of $15.40 
billion, a PE ratio of 9.80 and a beta of 0.89. Ryanair has a one year low of $65.61 and a one year high of $127.61. 
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last issued its quarterly earnings data on Monday, October 22nd. The transportation 
company reported $4.42 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the Zacks' consensus estimate of $4.62 
by ($0.20). Ryanair had a return on equity of 27.63% and a net margin of 17.13%. The firm had revenue of $3.21 
billion during the quarter, compared to the consensus estimate of $3.22 billion. On average, equities analysts 
predict that Ryanair will post 5.72 earnings per share for the current fiscal year. A number of hedge funds and other 
institutional investors have recently made changes to their positions in the stock. Capital International Investors 
boosted its position in shares of Ryanair by 38.0% in the third quarter. Capital International Investors now owns 
6,143,716 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $590,042,000 after purchasing an additional 
1,693,122 shares during the period. WCM Investment Management CA boosted its position in shares of Ryanair by 
7.6% in the third quarter. WCM Investment Management CA now owns 4,161,465 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $399,666,000 after purchasing an additional 295,462 shares during the period.

Ryanair ( RYAAY ) Stock Price Up 5.1%
Ryanair (RYAAY) Stock Price Up 5.1%
DailyPolitical
January 23, 2019 Wednesday 1:06 AM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 689 words
Body
Jan 22, 2019( DailyPolitical: http://www.dailypolitical.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY)'s share price rose 5.1% during trading on Tuesday . The stock traded as high as $71.98 and 
last traded at $69.09. Approximately 2,491,179 shares traded hands during mid-day trading, an increase of 167% 
from the average daily volume of 934,327 shares. The stock had previously closed at $65.75.RYAAY has been the 
subject of several research reports. Zacks Investment Research[1] raised shares of Ryanair from a "strong sell" 
rating to a "buy" rating and set a $83.00 price objective for the company in a research note on Tuesday, December 
11th. 
BidaskClub raised shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research note on Friday, November 
23rd. HSBC raised shares of Ryanair from a "reduce" rating to a "buy" rating in a research note on Tuesday. 
TheStreet downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "b-" rating to a "c+" rating in a research note on Thursday, 
November 15th. Finally, Morgan Stanley downgraded shares of Ryanair from an "overweight" rating to an "equal 
weight" rating in a research note on Tuesday. Four research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, five 
have assigned a hold rating and four have given a buy rating to the company. The company presently has a 
consensus rating of "Hold" and a consensus target price of $76.00.The company has a market cap of $15.40 billion, 
a PE ratio of 9.80 and a beta of 0.89. The company has a current ratio of 1.25, a quick ratio of 1.25 and a debt-to-
equity ratio of 0.62. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last released its quarterly earnings results on Monday, October 
22nd. The transportation company reported $4.42 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the Thomson 
Reuters' consensus estimate of $4.62 by ($0.20). The business had revenue of $3.21 billion for the quarter, 
compared to the consensus estimate of $3.22 billion. Ryanair had a net margin of 17.13% and a return on equity of 
27.63%. As a group, equities analysts predict that Ryanair Holdings plc will post 5.72 earnings per share for the 
current fiscal year. Several hedge funds have recently added to or reduced their stakes in RYAAY. Allianz Asset 
Management GmbH raised its stake in Ryanair by 4.1% during the third quarter. Allianz Asset Management GmbH 
now owns 762,682 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $73,248,000 after buying an additional 
30,088 shares during the last quarter. Victory Capital Management Inc. bought a new position in Ryanair during the 
third quarter worth $278,000. Marshall Wace LLP bought a new position in Ryanair during the third quarter worth 
$1,638,000. Thornburg Investment Management Inc. raised its stake in Ryanair by 4.4% during the third quarter. 
Thornburg Investment Management Inc. now owns 1,889,740 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$181,491,000 after buying an additional 79,755 shares during the last quarter. Finally, MML Investors Services LLC 
raised its stake in Ryanair by 48.5% during the third quarter. MML Investors Services LLC now owns 9,568 shares 
of the transportation company's stock worth $919,000 after buying an additional 3,127 shares during the last 
quarter. 43.59% of the stock is owned by hedge funds and other institutional investors. Ryanair Company Profile 
Ryanair ( RYAAY ) Stock Price Up 5.1%
(NASDAQ:RYAAY[2])Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline 
services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the 
provision of various ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight 
sale of beverages, food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel

London
London
Financial Times (London, England)
January 23, 2019 Wednesday
Edition 1, USA Edition
Copyright 2019 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: COMPANIES AND MARKETS;FEATURES; Pg. 20
Length: 196 words
Body
UK oil services stocks were under pressure after industry bellwether Halliburton gave a cautious first-quarter 
outlook, with Wood Group the day's sharpest blue-chip faller.
Exane BNP Paribas added to negative sentiment around Wood with a downgrade to "neutral". Debt reduction 
targets look challenging and accounting concerns need to be addressed, said the broker, which listed the treatment 
of exceptional costs, acquisition-related adjustments and lease liabilities as problem areas clouding the valuation.
Sector peer Hunting fell after Halliburton pointed to continued pricing pressure on fracking equipment.
EasyJet led an airline stock rally. Its first-quarter results matched forecasts once costs from drone disruption at 
Gatwick were ignored and came with unchanged guidance, in contrast to last week's profit warning from Ryanair.
Ocado gained after hosting an investor workshop to explain new reporting protocols. In the course of the meeting, 
management revealed "amazing" details on the fees charged for using its delivery warehouses, said Bernstein 
Research. The new data suggest earnings and cash flow forecasts "may be much too low in future years", it said. 
Bryce Elder
Load-Date: January 22, 2019
End of Document

European ADRs Move Lower in Tuesday Trading
European ADRs Move Lower in Tuesday Trading
MT Newswires Live Briefs
January 22, 2019 Tuesday 10:48 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 225 words
Body
 American depositary receipts of European stocks were trading 1.44% lower at 122.77 on the Bank of New York 
Mellon Europe ADR Index on Tuesday.
In continental Europe, the gainers were led by biotech companies Forward Pharma (FWP) and argenx (ARGX), 
which rose 6.7% and 2.9% respectively. They were followed by furniture maker Natuzzi (NTZ) and communications 
services provider VEON (VEON), which were up 1.7% and 1.2%.
The decliners in continental Europe were led by pharmaceutical company Oasmia Pharmaceutical (OASM) and 
telecommunications provider Telecom Italia (TI), which fell 21.3% and 9% respectively. They were followed by 
biopharmaceutical companies DBV Technologies (DBVT) and Cellectis (CLLS), which lost 7.9% and 3.6%.
In the UK and Ireland, the gainers were led by Midatech Pharma (MTP) and airline operator Ryanair (RYAAY), 
which climbed 5.5% and 5.3% respectively. They were followed by biopharmaceutical firm Verona Pharma (VRNA) 
and information and analytics provider RELX PLC (RELX), which were up 0.6% and 0.4%.
The decliners in the UK and Ireland were led by biopharmaceutical company Adaptimmune Therapeutics (ADAP), 
which dropped 4.7%, followed by mining companies BHP Billiton (BBL) and Rio Tinto (RIO), which lost 3.1% and 
2.7%. Pharmaceutical company Avadel (AVDL) was down 2.4%.
Price: 1.12, Change: +0.07, Percent Change: +6.67
Load-Date: January 23, 2019
End of Document
easyJet Posts Double Digit Growth in First Quarter Sales; Sees Full Year Profit in-Line With Market 
Expectations
easyJet Posts Double Digit Growth in First Quarter Sales; Sees Full Year 
Profit in-Line With Market Expectations
MT Newswires Live Briefs PRO
January 22, 2019 Tuesday 5:30 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 402 words
Body
 British budget airline easyJet (EZJ.L) forecast a full-year headline profit before tax which would be "broadly in line" 
with market expectations early Monday as it posted double digit growth in revenue during the fiscal first quarter.
Total sales jumped by 13.7% to 1.30 billion pounds ($1.67 billion) during the three months that ended December 
31, the carrier said in a trading statement for the fiscal first quarter. Higher sales were led by passenger and 
ancillary revenue, which climbed by 12.2% and 19.9%, respectively. 
Passenger volumes in the quarter advanced by 15.1% to 21.6 million, driven by a lower-than-planned increase in 
capacity of 18.2% to 24.1 million seats. 
The airline operator, however, noted a decline in load factor by two percentage points to 89.7%, as anticipated, due 
to the one-off increase in prior-year late demand and the dilutive impact of Tegel flying, which also contributed to 
the 4.2% constant-currency drop in total revenue per seat and was "in line with expectations." easyJet purchased 
Air Berlin's insolvent operations at the Tegel Airport in Berlin in late 2017.
The negative impact also came from one-off benefits in the same period last year - Air Berlin and Monarch 
bankruptcies and Ryanair's (RYAAY, RYA.L) winter schedule cancellations due to industrial action that brought a 
windfall of 30 million pounds and 20 million pounds, respectively.
The carrier, which has taken a 15 million-pound hit from the drones fiasco at Gatwick Airport recently, reported a 
1% constant currency increase in headline cost per seat excluding fuel, which was in part due to better-than-
expected crew retention following the Ryanair debacle.
Looking ahead, easyJet said it was "well prepared for Brexit," with 130 aircraft registered in Austria. It said that it 
has made "good progress" in ensuring a spare-parts pool in the European Union and in transferring crew licenses, 
both of which will be completed by March 29, the day Britain is scheduled to exit the world's largest trading bloc.
easyJet Posts Double Digit Growth in First Quarter Sales; Sees Full Year Profit in-Line With Market 
Expectations
Unlike Ryanair, which announced a profit warning last week, easyJet said that "demand currently remains solid and 
forward bookings for the period after 29th March are robust." As a result, expectations for the year ending 
September 2019 are "broadly in line" with a Bloomberg consensus headline pre-tax profit estimate of about 580 
million pounds.
Price: 1,220.00, Change: +58.50, Percent Change: +5.04
Load-Date: January 23, 2019
End of Document
Israel opens new Ramon Airport near Red Sea
Israel opens new Ramon Airport near Red Sea
MarketLine NewsWire (Formerly Datamonitor)
January 22, 2019 Tuesday 12:00 AM GMT
Copyright 2019 MarketLine All Rights Reserved
Section: AUTOMOTIVE, TRANSPORT AND LOGISTICS
Length: 251 words
Highlight: Israel's prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu has inaugurated the country's new Ramon International 
Airport near the Red Sea resort town of Eilat.
Body
The new airport will serve as an emergency alternative to Tel Aviv's Ben-Gurion airport.Netanyahu was quoted by 
i24NEWS AFP as saying: "Israel is opening up to the world. No longer an isolated corner, it's becoming a hub in 
international terms."RamonÂ Airport is capable of managing up to two million passengers per annum and will have 
its capacity expanded so that it can to welcome 4.2 million travellers by 2030.It is equipped with a 3,600m-long 
runway and has apron parking space that can accommodate up to nine large and wide-body aircraft. 
The airport also features freight-handling services.The facility will initially handle only domestic flights operated by 
Israeli airlines Arkia and Israir. International airlines including Ryanair, Wizz Air, easyJet, SAS, Finnair and Ural will 
start offering services at a later date.A total of NIS1.7bn ($455m) has been invested in the development of the 
airport since construction started in 2013.The Israel Airports Authority (IAA) changed the original plans for the 
Ramon project during the 2014 Gaza war."In an emergency, not only will Israel's entire passenger air fleet be able 
to land and park there, but also additional aircraft," the IAA told the publication.A 26m-high, 4.5km-long 'smart' anti-
missile fence has reportedly been installed in and around the airport to protect flights landing and taking off from the 
Ramon Airport as the airport lies close to the border with Jordan.The new airport is named after Israel's first 
astronaut, Ilan Ramon.
Load-Date: January 28, 2019
End of Document
London
London
Financial Times (London, England)
January 22, 2019 Tuesday
Edition 1, Asian Edition
Copyright 2019 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: COMPANIES AND MARKETS;FEATURES; Pg. 22
Length: 389 words
Body
Kingfisher was the FTSE 100's sharpest faller as fears about its French division led RBC to downgrade the DIY 
retailer.
Concerns about its products and online offering have led Kingfisher's Castorama chain to underperform the overall 
French market, RBC said. The broker also saw structural problems, arguing that while Castorama had more stores 
than main rival Leroy Merlin in high population areas, the latter's focus on lower-income neighbourhoods gave it 
greater exposure to faster growing populations.
Hammerson led real estate developers lower after JPMorgan Cazenove said retail property was facing a perfect 
storm of headwinds. The worsening newsflow from the UK over Christmas suggested buyers of shopping centres 
would increasingly incorporate expectations of falling rents into their forecasts, said JPMorgan. Its analysis found 
only three examples since 1987 when UK property stocks gained while capital values were falling.
Housebuilders Berkeley and Taylor Wimpey edged lower after Rightmove's January survey showed London asking 
prices falling to their weakest level in more than three years.
Rentokil slipped, with Goldman Sachs removing the stock from its "buy" list on valuation grounds. The pest control 
group "combines an attractive organic growth profile with significant potential to grow" via acquisitions, particularly 
to consolidate its position in North America and expand to emerging markets, Goldman said. But based on forward 
earnings Rentokil's valuation has touched a record high and the stock sits at a 100 per cent premium to the wider 
market, so better value can be found elsewhere, the broker argued.
London
BAE Systems gained after agreeing to sell a majority stake in its UK-based combat vehicles business to 
Rheinmetall of Germany.
Wizz Air and Ryanair both gained on the back of a positive note from Davy Stockbrokers, which argued that 
European airline stocks were too cheap given capacity growth was likely to slow and fuel costs had eased.
Dixons Carphone rose on a report that Elliott Advisors, the activist investor, was considering taking a stake.
RPC inched higher on expectations that Apollo Global Management would agree to buy the packaging maker as 
early as today. Apollo first admitted to takeover talks with RPC four months ago and has been widely reported to be 
raising finance for a deal. Bryce Elder
Load-Date: January 21, 2019
End of Document
London
London
Financial Times (London, England)
January 22, 2019 Tuesday
Edition 1, USA Edition
Copyright 2019 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: COMPANIES AND MARKETS;FEATURES; Pg. 22
Length: 389 words
Body
Kingfisher was the FTSE 100's sharpest faller as fears about its French division led RBC to downgrade the DIY 
retailer.
Concerns about its products and online offering have led Kingfisher's Castorama chain to underperform the overall 
French market, RBC said. The broker also saw structural problems, arguing that while Castorama had more stores 
than main rival Leroy Merlin in high population areas, the latter's focus on lower-income neighbourhoods gave it 
greater exposure to faster growing populations.
Hammerson led real estate developers lower after JPMorgan Cazenove said retail property was facing a perfect 
storm of headwinds. The worsening newsflow from the UK over Christmas suggested buyers of shopping centres 
would increasingly incorporate expectations of falling rents into their forecasts, said JPMorgan. Its analysis found 
only three examples since 1987 when UK property stocks gained while capital values were falling.
Housebuilders Berkeley and Taylor Wimpey edged lower after Rightmove's January survey showed London asking 
prices falling to their weakest level in more than three years.
Rentokil slipped, with Goldman Sachs removing the stock from its "buy" list on valuation grounds. The pest control 
group "combines an attractive organic growth profile with significant potential to grow" via acquisitions, particularly 
to consolidate its position in North America and expand to emerging markets, Goldman said. But based on forward 
earnings Rentokil's valuation has touched a record high and the stock sits at a 100 per cent premium to the wider 
market, so better value can be found elsewhere, the broker argued.

https://www.marketbeat.com/logos/ryanair-holdings-plc-logo.pngUBS Group reissued their buy rating on shares of 
Ryanair (LON:RYA) in a research report report published on Monday morning,            www.boersen-zeitung.de[1] 
reports.Shares of RYA stock[2] opened at GBX 10.77 ($0.14) on Monday. Ryanair has a fifty-two week low of GBX 
13.99 ($0.18) and a fifty-two week high of GBX 19.78 ($0.26). In related news, insider Julie O'Neill bought 1,000 
shares of the stock in a transaction that occurred on Thursday, November 1st. The stock was acquired at an 
average cost of GBX 1,240 ($16.20) per share, with a total value of 12,400 ($16,202.80). Ryanair Company 
ProfileRyanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, 
the United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various 
ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, 
food, and merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its 
Website.Featured Article: How to Profit and Limit Losses With Stop Orders [3] [ 1]:

Ryanair ( RYAAY ) Stock Rating Lowered by Morgan Stanley
Ryanair (RYAAY) Stock Rating Lowered by Morgan Stanley
DailyPolitical
January 22, 2019 Tuesday 1:05 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 714 words
Body
Jan 22, 2019( DailyPolitical: http://www.dailypolitical.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) was 
downgraded by stock analysts at Morgan Stanley from an "overweight" rating to an "equal weight" rating in a 
research note issued to investors on Tuesday, The Fly[1] reports.Other equities analysts also recently issued 
reports about the stock. HSBC raised shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research note on 
Tuesday. ValuEngine[2] downgraded shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "strong sell" rating in a research 
note on Tuesday, January 15th. 
Zacks Investment Research[3] raised shares of Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a "buy" rating and set a $83.00 
target price on the stock in a research note on Tuesday, December 11th. BidaskClub downgraded shares of 
Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "sell" rating in a research note on Wednesday, January 16th. Finally, Macquarie 
initiated coverage on shares of Ryanair in a research note on Tuesday, November 27th. They set an 
"underperform" rating on the stock. Four equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, five have 
issued a hold rating and four have assigned a buy rating to the company. Ryanair has a consensus rating of "Hold" 
and a consensus price target of $76.00.NASDAQ:RYAAY[4] opened at $65.75 on Tuesday. The company has a 
current ratio of 1.25, a quick ratio of 1.25 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.62. The stock has a market capitalization of 
$15.40 billion, a PE ratio of 9.33 and a beta of 0.89. Ryanair has a twelve month low of $65.61 and a twelve month 
high of $127.61. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its quarterly earnings results on Monday, October 22nd. 
The transportation company reported $4.42 earnings per share for the quarter, missing the Thomson Reuters' 
consensus estimate of $4.62 by ($0.20). The business had revenue of $3.21 billion during the quarter, compared to 
analysts' expectations of $3.22 billion. Ryanair had a return on equity of 27.63% and a net margin of 17.13%. On 
average, research analysts anticipate that Ryanair will post 5.72 earnings per share for the current year. A number 
of hedge funds have recently modified their holdings of the business. Allianz Asset Management GmbH raised its 
stake in shares of Ryanair by 4.1% in the 3rd quarter. Allianz Asset Management GmbH now owns 762,682 shares 
of the transportation company's stock valued at $73,248,000 after acquiring an additional 30,088 shares during the 
period. Victory Capital Management Inc. purchased a new stake in shares of Ryanair in the 3rd quarter valued at 
approximately $278,000. Marshall Wace LLP purchased a new stake in shares of Ryanair in the 3rd quarter valued 
at approximately $1,638,000. Thornburg Investment Management Inc. raised its stake in shares of Ryanair by 4.4% 
in the 3rd quarter. Thornburg Investment Management Inc. now owns 1,889,740 shares of the transportation 
company's stock valued at $181,491,000 after acquiring an additional 79,755 shares during the period. Finally, 
MML Investors Services LLC raised its stake in shares of Ryanair by 48.5% in the 3rd quarter. MML Investors 
Services LLC now owns 9,568 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $919,000 after acquiring an 
additional 3,127 shares during the period. 43.59% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors. About 
Ryanair ( RYAAY ) Stock Rating Lowered by Morgan Stanley

FNY Investment Advisers LLC Takes $998,000 Position in Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY )
FNY Investment Advisers LLC Takes $998,000 Position in Ryanair Holdings 
plc (RYAAY)
DailyPolitical
January 22, 2019 Tuesday 7:06 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 733 words
Body
Jan 22, 2019( DailyPolitical: http://www.dailypolitical.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  FNY Investment Advisers LLC 
purchased a new position in Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) in the fourth quarter, according to the 
company in its most recent disclosure with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The firm purchased 
14,000 shares of the transportation company's stock, valued at approximately $998,000. Other hedge funds have 
also made changes to their positions in the company. Diversified Trust Co lifted its holdings in Ryanair by 35.1% in 
the 4th quarter. Diversified Trust Co now owns 20,702 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$1,477,000 after purchasing an additional 5,376 shares in the last quarter. 
Quadrant Capital Group LLC lifted its holdings in Ryanair by 2,727.3% in the 4th quarter. Quadrant Capital Group 
LLC now owns 933 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $65,000 after purchasing an additional 900 
shares in the last quarter. Scout Investments Inc. lifted its holdings in Ryanair by 11.2% in the 4th quarter. Scout 
Investments Inc. now owns 245,022 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $17,480,000 after 
purchasing an additional 24,756 shares in the last quarter. Marshall Wace LLP purchased a new position in Ryanair 
in the 3rd quarter worth approximately $1,638,000. Finally, Advisors Asset Management Inc. lifted its holdings in 
Ryanair by 10.9% in the 3rd quarter. Advisors Asset Management Inc. now owns 8,440 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $811,000 after purchasing an additional 832 shares in the last quarter. 43.59% of the stock 
is owned by institutional investors. A number of research analysts recently commented on the company. Morgan 
Stanley cut Ryanair from an "overweight" rating to an "equal weight" rating in a report on Tuesday. HSBC raised 
Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on Tuesday. Zacks Investment Research[1] raised Ryanair 
from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating and set a $76.00 price target on the stock in a report on Monday. BidaskClub 
cut Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "sell" rating in a report on Wednesday, January 16th. Finally, ValuEngine[2] cut 
Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "strong sell" rating in a report on Tuesday, January 15th. Four analysts have rated 
the stock with a sell rating, five have issued a hold rating and four have issued a buy rating to the company's stock. 
The stock presently has a consensus rating of "Hold" and a consensus target price of $76.00.Shares of RYAAY[3] 
traded up $3.50 during mid-day trading on Tuesday, hitting $69.25. 1,756,449 shares of the stock were exchanged, 
compared to its average volume of 589,564. The stock has a market capitalization of $15.40 billion, a price-to-
earnings ratio of 9.82 and a beta of 0.89. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 52-week low of $65.61 and a 52-week high of 
$127.61. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.62, a current ratio of 1.25 and a quick ratio of 1.25. Ryanair 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) last issued its quarterly earnings data on Monday, October 22nd. The transportation company 
reported $4.42 earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the Thomson Reuters' consensus estimate of 
$4.62 by ($0.20). The firm had revenue of $3.21 billion for the quarter, compared to analysts' expectations of $3.22 
FNY Investment Advisers LLC Takes $998,000 Position in Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY )
billion. Ryanair had a return on equity of 27.63% and a net margin of 17.13%. On average, sell-side analysts expect 
that Ryanair Holdings plc will post 5.72 earnings per share for the current year.  About RyanairRyanair Holdings plc, 
together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, and 
Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary services, such as non-
flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and merchandise; and 
marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.Further Reading:

Ryanair ( RYAAY ) Upgraded to Buy by Zacks Investment Research
Ryanair (RYAAY) Upgraded to Buy by Zacks Investment Research
Watchlist News
January 21, 2019 Monday 1:05 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 882 words
Body
Jan 21, 2019( Watchlist News: http://www.watchlistnews.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) 
was upgraded by Zacks Investment Research[1] from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research report issued on 
Monday. The brokerage currently has a $76.00 price objective on the transportation company's stock. Zacks 
Investment Research[2]'s price objective would suggest a potential upside of 15.59% from the company's previous 
close. 
According to Zacks, "Ryanair is being aided by strong demand for air travel, especially due to low air fares. Notably, 
traffic in December rose 12% year over year. We are also impressed by Ryanair's efforts to reward shareholders in 
the form of share buybacks. In tune with this, the carrier returned more than €540 m to shareholders in the first six 
months of fiscal 2019. We remain positive on the collective deals signed by the company with German Pilot union. 
We expect strong traffic to aid its fiscal third-quarter results as well. Detailed results should be out on Feb 4. The 
Zacks Consensus Estimate for fiscal 2019 earnings increased 0.4% over the last 60 days. On the flip side, 
continued labor unrest is hurting Ryanair significantly. The stock has shed more than 45% of its value in a year's 
time mainly due to the labor unrest."RYAAY has been the subject of several other research reports. TheStreet cut 
Ryanair from a "b-" rating to a "c+" rating in a research report on Thursday, November 15th. BidaskClub raised 
Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a "sell" rating in a research report on Saturday, September 29th. Macquarie 
started coverage on Ryanair in a research report on Tuesday, November 27th. They set an "underperform" rating 
for the company. ValuEngine[3] cut Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "strong sell" rating in a research report on 
Tuesday, January 15th. Finally, Berenberg Bank cut Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "sell" rating in a research 
report on Tuesday, January 8th. Four analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, four have issued a hold rating 
and three have given a buy rating to the stock. The stock currently has an average rating of "Hold" and a consensus 
target price of $76.00.Shares of RYAAY stock[4] opened at $65.75 on Monday. Ryanair has a 1 year low of $65.61 
and a 1 year high of $127.61. The firm has a market cap of $15.40 billion, a PE ratio of 9.33 and a beta of 0.89. The 
company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.62, a quick ratio of 1.25 and a current ratio of 1.25. Ryanair 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) last issued its earnings results on Monday, October 22nd. The transportation company reported 
$4.42 EPS for the quarter, missing the Thomson Reuters' consensus estimate of $4.62 by ($0.20). The business 
had revenue of $3.21 billion during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of $3.22 billion. Ryanair had a return 
on equity of 27.63% and a net margin of 17.13%. As a group, research analysts expect that Ryanair will post 5.72 
earnings per share for the current year. Hedge funds and other institutional investors have recently added to or 
reduced their stakes in the business. Quadrant Capital Group LLC boosted its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 
2,727.3% in the 4th quarter. Quadrant Capital Group LLC now owns 933 shares of the transportation company's 
stock worth $65,000 after acquiring an additional 900 shares in the last quarter. Raymond James Trust N.A. 
Ryanair ( RYAAY ) Upgraded to Buy by Zacks Investment Research
acquired a new position in Ryanair during the 3rd quarter worth $251,000. Victory Capital Management Inc. 
acquired a new position in Ryanair during the 3rd quarter worth $278,000. Voya Investment Management LLC lifted 
its holdings in Ryanair by 35.2% during the 2nd quarter. Voya Investment Management LLC now owns 2,975 
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $340,000 after buying an additional 775 shares in the last 
quarter. Finally, Jane Street Group LLC acquired a new position in Ryanair during the 2nd quarter worth $371,000. 
43.59% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors. About RyanairRyanair Holdings plc, together with 
its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, and Other European 
countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary services, such as non-flight scheduled 
services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and merchandise; and marketing 
accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.Read More: Discount

Ryanair (RYAAY) Earning Somewhat Negative Press Coverage, Analysis Finds
Ryanair (RYAAY) Earning Somewhat Negative Press Coverage, Analysis 
Finds
DailyPolitical
January 21, 2019 Monday 7:05 AM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 712 words
Body
Jan 20, 2019( DailyPolitical: http://www.dailypolitical.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Media stories about Ryanair 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) have been trending somewhat negative this week, InfoTrie Sentiment reports. The research 
group identifies negative and positive news coverage by analyzing more than six thousand news and blog sources. 
The firm ranks coverage of publicly-traded companies on a scale of negative five to positive five, with scores 
nearest to five being the most favorable. 
Ryanair earned a coverage optimism score of -1.44 on their scale. InfoTrie also assigned news articles about the 
transportation company an news buzz score of 10 out of 10, meaning that recent news coverage is extremely likely 
to have an effect on the company's share price in the immediate future. These are some of the media headlines 
that 
may 
have 
impacted

Carlos Ghosn[5] (kpax.com) Several equities analysts have recently issued reports on the company. BidaskClub 
raised Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Tuesday, October 9th. Zacks Investment 
Research[6] reissued a "hold" rating on shares of Ryanair in a report on Monday, December 31st. ValuEngine[7] cut 
Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "strong sell" rating in a report on Tuesday, October 2nd. Berenberg Bank cut 
Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "sell" rating in a report on Tuesday, January 8th. Finally, Macquarie assumed 
coverage on Ryanair in a report on Tuesday, November 27th. They issued an "underperform" rating for the 
company. Four investment analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, five have given a hold rating and two 
have assigned a buy rating to the stock. The stock presently has a consensus rating of "Hold" and a consensus 
target price of $83.00.NASDAQ RYAAY[8] opened at $65.75 on Monday. The stock has a market capitalization of 
$15.40 billion, a P/E ratio of 9.33 and a beta of 0.89. Ryanair has a twelve month low of $65.61 and a twelve month 
high of $127.61. The company has a quick ratio of 1.25, a current ratio of 1.25 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.62. 
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last released its quarterly earnings results on Monday, October 22nd. The 
transportation company reported $4.42 earnings per share for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus estimates 
of $4.62 by ($0.20). The business had revenue of $3.21 billion during the quarter, compared to analyst estimates of 
$3.22 billion. Ryanair had a return on equity of 27.63% and a net margin of 17.13%. As a group, equities research 
analysts expect that Ryanair will post 5.72 EPS for the current year. About RyanairRyanair Holdings plc, together 
with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the United Kingdom, and Other 
European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary services, such as non-flight

FTSE eyes 7,000 as pound dips ahead of Brexit ‘Plan B’
FTSE eyes 7,000 as pound dips ahead of Brexit ‘Plan B’
Citywire
January 21, 2019 Monday 11:19 AM GMT
Copyright 2019 Citywire Financial Publishers All Rights Reserved
Length: 406 words
Byline: Vicky McKeever
Highlight: FTSE 100 edges towards 7,000 mark, boosted by sterling weakness, as prime minister Theresa May 
prepares to issue Brexit ‘Plan B’ statement.
Body
The FTSE 100 has edged closer to the 7,000 mark, boosted by a fall in the pound ahead of prime minister Theresa 
May's announcement of  her Brexit ‘Plan B’ in parliament later today.
The blue-chip index rose 17 points, or 0.2%, to 6,985 as the pound dipped a quarter of a cent to $1.285 against the 
dollar.
A weaker pound tends to support the FTSE 100 as its stocks rely on overseas markets for around three-quarters of 
their earnings.
Weakness in the British currency comes as May prepares to issue an alternative Brexit deal to break the deadlock 
in parliament. May has had three days to prepare her ‘Plan B’ for the UK’s departure from the EU, after her initial 
deal was rejected by MPs last week.
Markets have strengthened on the expectation that the UK would not leave the EU without a deal.
‘How she will manage to get parliamentary consensus is completely unclear given that her proposal was rejected by 
402 out of 650 MPs last week and her subsequent attempt to find common ground with Labour didn’t yield any 
results,’ said Cityindex senior market analyst Fiona Cincotta.
‘EU politicians are not showing any more signs of willingness to cooperate than MPs and instead keep 
signalling that they are unwilling to agree to any more concessions for Britain.’
Easyjet (EZJ) was one of the biggest large-cap risers, with shares up 1.8% to £11.93, ahead of tomorrow's results.
Several analysts have upgraded their forecast on the airline, helping the shares to steady after rival Ryanair 
(RYA.I) issued a profit warning last week. The budget airline's contingency plans for no-deal Brexit are likely to be 
in focus.
On the FTSE 250, Just Eat (JE) fell 1.2% to 650p as Peter Plumb, chief executive of the takeaway ordering 
website, abruptly stepped down after just 16 months in the role.
FTSE eyes 7,000 as pound dips ahead of Brexit ‘Plan B’
Plumb had upgraded Just Eat’s technology, in a bid to keep pace with the likes of Deliveroo and Uber Eats, though 
increasing investment in the initiative caused earnings momentum to slow.
Just Eat also updated its earnings forecasts, with expected revenue of about £780 million in 2018 and underlying 
core earnings to range between £172 and £174 million, both ahead of analysts’ consensus forecasts.
Crude prices briefly rose to their highest point in 2019 so far after data showed refinery processing in China, the 
world’s second largest oil consumer, reaching a record high last year.
After climbing to $62.75 per barrel, Brent crude futures fell back to $62.49.
Load-Date: January 21, 2019
End of Document
